summary.main: The kubelet parameter --eviction-max-pod-grace-period does not work as expected when set to a negative number, causing pods to be terminated immediately instead of using the pod's specified value for TerminationGracePeriodSeconds.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The parameter --eviction-max-pod-grace-period should be set to a non-negative number. If it is set to a negative number, it should use the pod's specified value for TerminationGracePeriodSeconds.
summary.attemptedFixes: The discussion suggests that the issue can be fixed by updating the documentation instead of changing the code. The current behavior is considered acceptable, and the documentation should reflect the actual behavior.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about the kubelet parameter --eviction-max-pod-grace-period not working as expected. The description says that when the parameter is set to a negative number, it should use the pod's specified value for TerminationGracePeriodSeconds, but instead, it always sends -1 to the CRI runtime, causing the pod to be terminated immediately.

issueDTO.title: Add button to admin view for manually closing an election
issueDTO.description:
Currently elections will close if there's an end time set and the election passes the end time, but there's no way to close the election if the end time isn't set.

The admin should have a toggle button for closing the election. And then untoggling it will move the election back to open.

For now this feature should only be available for elections where the start and end time isn't set. That way we don't have to worry about the logic of the two systems conflicting. 

In the future there should be more protections for how often the admin can do this (see break glass auditing flow https://github.com/Equal-Vote/star-server/issues/317 ), but for now I think it's fine to let the admin freely toggle it on and off
comments: The election close need a max time for close? for example if you dont determine the end time can close automaticaly at 00:00 and add the button if you need close the election if the admin like do that

> The election close need a max time for close? for example if you dont determine the end time can close automaticaly at 00:00 and add the button if you need close the election if the admin like do that

I don't think elections should have an end time by default. The toggle should only be visible on the admin page if all of the following conditions are true
1. There is no end time set
2. The election has already been finalized (the toggle wouldn't make sense during draft mode)

Let me know if that helps, I'm not sure if I understood your question

Here's some detailed steps for making the backend change

 - Duplicate archiveElectionController to setOpenStateController
	- toggles between finalized and closed)
	- error if election isn't one of those state
	- setPublicResults is a good reference, it also just takes a boolean parameter
 - Reference updateElectionStateIfNeeded to see how to close elections
 - Add api route under elections.routes.ts for /Election/:id/setOpenState
 - https://bettervoting.com/API/Docs/ is a good reference
 - add a useSetOpenState hook under useAPI.ts in the frontend

repository.description: STAR Voting is an upgrade to our current way of voting that allows voters to score candidates from 0 to 5. Ultimately, STAR Voting elects candidates who better represent the whole of the electorate. We are building a site that lets everyone from individuals to organizations use STAR Voting to host simple polls or run secure elections.
repository.name: bettervoting

summary.main: Add a button to the admin view for manually closing an election, allowing the admin to toggle the election between finalized and closed states
summary.validationOrRequirement: The admin should have a toggle button for closing the election. The election should only be closable if the end time isn't set and the election has already been finalized.
summary.attemptedFixes: Duplicate archiveElectionController to setOpenStateController, toggles between finalized and closed, error if election isn't one of those states, setPublicResults is a good reference, updateElectionStateIfNeeded to see how to close elections, add api route under elections.routes.ts for /Election/:id/setOpenState, add a useSetOpenState hook under useAPI.ts in the frontend
summary.otherNotes: The feature should only be available for elections where the start and end time isn't set. In the future, there should be more protections for how often the admin can close the election.

issueDTO.title: [Margin app] Create `/admin/me` endpoint
issueDTO.description:
## Guideline
1. Carefully read the issue description before applying to ensure you have all the necessary information to start working on it.
2. Write a brief description of how you will approach the task (without using ChatGPT).
3. Add your Telegram handler in your application (e.g., in OnlyDust or similar)
4. Write ETA in your application



## What should I do if I have a problem
1. Try to google it before asking. Googling is taking major part of dev work 
2. If you couldn't find answer your question with Google, text your question to [dev](https://t.me/spotnet_dev/4) group with your question.
3. Do not send DM to maintainer, it would be better and faster to ask other contributors in chat 


## How to prepare PR
1. Check if your code [smell](https://refactoring.guru/refactoring/smells) good
2. Add `close #<issue number>` to link your issue with your PR
3. Do not commit changes that are unrelated to your task
4. Check after you created PR, if you committed everything

issueDTO.title: Path subsitution
issueDTO.description:
### What would you like sesh to do?

As a user, I want to define global substitution rules, so I can create custom session name rules to improve my session names and create a more streamlined workflow.

# Example

- `~/c/dotfiles/.config/neovim` could be changed to `💻 neovim` (replacing `~/c/dotfiles/.config`)

```toml
[namer]
[[find_and_replace]]
find = "~/c/dotfiles/.config/"
replace = "💻 "
```
comments:
Hi @joshmedeski 

First off; thanks for providing sesh! It's been a great time saver within my workflow for some time now.

I'm planning on submitting a PR for this exact feature, but I'd want to discuss a few things:
- Should the "namer" only apply to i.E. zoxide items or all items? In my eyes, zoxide would benefit the most from this setting as I wouldn't want to accidentally rename any tmux or config defined sessions. Based on the decision I'd name the config field either `path_substitution` (if zoxide only) or `name_substitution` instead of `namer` (all)
- I'd support regular expressions out of the box by trying to create a regexp based on "find", if it fails I'd fall back to literal substitution.
- I'd add opt-in support for expanding env variables with `expand_env_vars = true` for portable configs (which could be useful for eg. `find = "$HOME/.local/share/git`)
- I'd add a `priority` field to control which substitution takes precedence (default `0`)

Let me know what you thought about the feature or if you have any other recommendations/ideas 😁 
Hey @janbiasi! 

Thanks for the detailed proposal and for wanting to contribute this feature! Here are my thoughts on your questions:

- **Config naming**: I agree with `name_substitution` over `namer` - it's clearer about what we're doing (changing session names). I'd also prefer this to apply to **all session sources** (zoxide, config-defined) rather than just zoxide. Note that existing tmux sessions wouldn't be impacted since they already exist - this would only affect how new sessions are named when created. Let's start simple with this global application and we can add source-specific controls later if users need that level of granularity.

- **Regex support**: Sounds good! Actually, we already have a substitution library in the project - check out the `replacer` package. It might be worth leveraging what's already there rather than building from scratch.

- **Environment variables**: I like the idea, but let's keep the first version simpler and get a solid proof of concept working first. We can add env var expansion in a follow-up.

- **Priority field**: Same thinking - let's start simple. For v1, we could just match on the first rule that applies. If multiple rules can be applied without conflicting, that's fine, but let's not overcomplicate the initial implementation.

My preference is to start with a minimal viable version that covers the core use case, then iterate based on user feedback. Does this direction align with what you were thinking?

Looking forward to the PR! 🚀

issueDTO.description:
## Guideline
1. Carefully read the issue description before applying to ensure you have all the necessary information to start working on it.
2. Write a brief description of how you will approach the task (without using ChatGPT).
3. Add your Telegram handler in your application (e.g., in OnlyDust or similar)
4. Write ETA in your application



## What should I do if I have a problem
1. Try to google it before asking. Googling is taking major part of dev work 
2. If you couldn't find answer your question with Google, text your question to [dev](https://t.me/spotnet_dev/4) group with your question.
3. Do not send DM to maintainer, it would be better and faster to ask other contributors in chat 


## How to prepare PR
1. Check if your code [smell](https://refactoring.guru/refactoring/smells) good
2.  Add `close #<issue number>` to link your issue with your PR
3.  Do not commit changes which is not related to your task 
4. Check after you created PR, if you committed everything.


## Task Description
1. Implement CRUD methods to retrieve the data shown in the following diagram:

   ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cb26457a-78c3-4f47-bdc6-876f4b917848)

It will be calculated by summing the token amounts across all `user_pools` and multiplying them by their current prices, as defined in [this issue](https://github.com/djeck1432/spotnet/issues/909).

2. Add a new endpoint `/admin/statistic/assets` in the [`admin.py`](https://github.com/djeck1432/spotnet/blob/main/margin/margin_app/app/api/admin.py) file to expose this data.
3. Write tests for the new endpoint, covering both positive and negative scenarios.
4. Verify that all CI workflows pass and the endpoint functions correctly.

issueDTO.title: 🐛 Scroll Position Persists When Navigating Through Navbar Items
issueDTO.description:
## 📛 Bug Description

When using the navbar, everything functions correctly initially. However, there???s an issue related to scroll behavior. Suppose there are five items in the navbar: **Dashboard**, **Learning Hub**, **Study Buddy**, **Tech Feed**, **Resume Builder**, and **Placement Prep**.

- If I am on the **Dashboard** and I haven't scrolled at all, then navigating to any other item works perfectly.
- BUT if I **scroll down a bit on the Dashboard**, and then **navigate to another navbar item**, that new item **also opens with the same scrolled position**. It doesn't load from the top.

This causes a poor user experience and inconsistent navigation between pages.

---

## 📍 Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to the homepage (**Dashboard**).
2. Scroll down a little (just a bit).
3. Now click on any other item in the navbar (e.g., **Learning Hub** or **Resume Builder**).
4. Notice that the new page is **already scrolled down**, instead of starting at the top.

---

## 🤔 Expected Behavior

When navigating between navbar items or pages:
- The page should always load from the top (`window.scrollTo(0, 0)`).
- Scroll position from the previous page should **not** be retained.

---

## 💻 Environment

- **OS**: Windows 10  
- **Browser**: Chrome 117.0.5938.62  
- **GitHub Username**: @Aishwarya-1202  
- **Program**: GSSoC'25 Contributor  

---

## 🎯 Screenshots / Videos 

*If required, I have shared a short screen recording showing the bug.*

issueDTO.title: Support __has_feature(cfi)
issueDTO.description: We should follow suite with the feature checking as with other sanitizers.
comments:
Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor is working on this issue. If someone is assigned to the issue or claimed to be working on it, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. Leave a comment indicating that you are working on the issue, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.

issueDTO.title: Prometheus: Don't use incremental querying if query contains $__range variable
issueDTO.description:
Prometheus queries should not be incrementally queried when they contain  `$__range` variable. Because 

> This variable represents the range for the current dashboard.

See [variable docs](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/dashboards/variables/add-template-variables/#__range).
comments: I can give this a shot as a first issue

Is there an update on this issue? I'm surprised it hasn't gotten more traction; doesn't it break any panel datasource with `$__range`? Incremental querying is [enabled by default](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/datasources/prometheus/#:~:text=Incremental%20dashboard%20queries%20(beta)&text=Additionally%2C%20the%20amount%20of%20overlap,is%2010m%20(10%20minutes)) on Grafana 10+.

Just ran into this with a Stat panel showing total data transferred over the dashboard time range (e.g. `increase(pppstats_rx_in[$__range])`).
The Query inspector showed that on auto refresh, `$__range` was replaced with `699s` instead of the correct value of `86400s` (24h).

As a bonus, the _Run queries_ button in the query editor works fine.

Grafana v11.5.1 (c6c701cf5b)
Any Updates?
+1. Ran into this as soon as we migrated a few dashboards from Grafana v9 to v12 where we had enabled this feature.

I just created the PR to address this https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/108823 
Thank you all gor your patience!

issueDTO.title: `std::time::SystemTime` has nanosecond precision but Payjoin only sees u32 UnixTime second precision
issueDTO.description:
In roundtrip testing a new concrete `v2::PjParams` struct I realized `SystemTime` includes nanosecond precision. After serializing `SystemTime` into the `EX1` u32 expiration parameter, and deserializing back into the type that precision is lost and an `assert_eq` failed, raising this issue, since we are storing time as `SystemTime` in many parts of the `payjoin` crate.

It seems to me that encoding this information internally as precise as the URL-serialized representation would be more accurate. For this purpose we may even use [`bitcoin::absolute::Time`](https://docs.rs/bitcoin/latest/bitcoin/absolute/struct.Time.html). Other than accuracy, changing to a u32 UnixTime abstraction gives us the advantage that u32 would work in `wasm` where `SystemTime` is not available.

I think this may be a good first issue to start, but it might be tricky to get the ergonomics right to completely close this issue. We'd need to figure out what type (`u64`, `u32`, or `bitcoin::absolute::Time`?) to expose in the API arguments and across the FFI boundary even if the internal representation becomes `absolute::Time`. We may take a look at how conversion ergonomics from `SystemTime::now()` to `bitcoin::absolute::Time` (or similar functionality) are designed as inspiration.
comments: Can I be assigned this issue

From @Mshehu5, somewhere else:

> From what I understand, the task involves replacing the use of SystemTime in the codebase with bitcoin::absolute::Time, correct?

> If so, could you please clarify which specific parts of the codebase should be updated?

Specifically the issue is replacing the use of SystemTime in the functional state machine of the `payjoin` crate. The structured data (structs, enums, errors, etc.) relying on `std::time::SystemTime` need to rely on `u64`, `u32`, or `bitcoin::absolute::Time` instead, since only the latter encodes the second (rather than nanosecond) precision with which the protocol is concerned. I suggest studying the difference between the types, making a suggestion, and writing up rationale for whatever decision you find most appropriate or otherwise asking specific questions about the differences between them. `bitcoin::absolute::Time` came up because it's already a dependency and makes it explicit we're talking about a concrete unix time as a seconds-precision unsigned integer under the hood, but you could argue for u64 or u32 as well.

Working around `SystemTime::now()` calls is outside of the scope of this issue. That call does have side-effects that should be eventually worked around by making the state machine methods that currently call `SystemTime::now()` take `now` in seconds as input (in the type you choose) instead. This can be done as a follow up or separate concern.

summary.attemptedFixes: Replacing the use of SystemTime with bitcoin::absolute::Time, considering u64, u32, or bitcoin::absolute::Time as alternatives, and studying the differences between them.

issueDTO.title: The problem classifier LLM model reports an error
issueDTO.description: ### Self Checks - [x] This is only for bug report, if you would like to ask a question, please head to [Discussions](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/discussions/categories/general). - [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues), including closed ones. - [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report (????????????????????? [Language Policy](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/1542)). - [x] [FOR CHINESE USERS] ??????????????????????????? Issue?????????????????????????????????:) - [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields. ### Dify version 1.6.0 ### Cloud or Self Hosted Self Hosted (Docker) ### Steps to reproduce At the problem classifier node, [openai] Error: PluginInvokeError: Error messages of {"args":{},"error_type":"AttributeError","message":"'NoneType' object has no attribute 'content'"}. And this problem is not inevitable. The specific steps are shown in the following figure: Error flow in the same conversation: The correct process in the same conversation: Node details??? I think the possible causes of this problem??? Because the question classifier node has a specific format for parsing, such as JSON format or others, when answering questions through the built-in prompt words of dify, it does not actually return in the required format of the prompt words 1. It might be that the LLM large model lacks sufficient intelligence (this has been tested. deepseek-chat issues always occur, gpt-4o occasionally shows up, and gpt-4.1 basically never appears). 2. The content of the online text is too much, confusing the LLM's understanding of the prompt words The above is only for my own reference after testing ### ?????? Expected Behavior An error should not occur ### ??? Actual Behavior An error occurred
comments:
<!-- Answer -->
The error `'NoneType' object has no attribute 'content'` happens when the LLM response is missing or malformed???often because the model didn't return output in the expected JSON format. This is more common with models like deepseek-chat, less so with gpt-4o, and rarely with gpt-4.1, likely due to differences in how reliably each model follows prompt instructions.

The code for the problem classifier node (QuestionClassifierNode) expects a valid response and does not always check if the LLM's reply is None before trying to access its content, which can trigger this error if the model fails to return a proper result. This risk increases if the prompt is complex or the input is large, making it harder for the LLM to follow the required format. The codebase has some error handling for invalid JSON, but not for missing responses, so an explicit check for None before accessing `.content` would make this more robust [(source)](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/7bf3d2c8bf5715305e1615fb4a5ba02c42d03643/api/core/workflow/nodes/question_classifier/question_classifier_node.py).

To reduce these errors: use models known to follow instructions well (like gpt-4.1), keep prompts and context concise, and consider adding a None check in the code before accessing `.content` to prevent unhandled exceptions. Prompt engineering???making the output format requirement very explicit and simple???can also help.

issueDTO.title: Update the nightly tests to run that latest published version of npm packages
issueDTO.description: Currently the tests are running against the version specified in package.json
comments:
Hi @critesjosh . I intend to do this, and here is my plan.

### Implementation Plan for Nightly Tests Using Latest npm Package Versions

**Objective:**  
Update all nightly test workflows to install and test against the latest published versions of npm packages, rather than only those pinned in `package.json`.

---

#### 1. Identify All Nightly Workflows

- Locate every GitHub Actions workflow that runs on a scheduled basis (i.e., includes a `schedule:` trigger).

#### 2. Find JS Dependency Installation Steps

- In each workflow, identify steps that install JavaScript dependencies (typically using `yarn install` or `npm install`).

#### 3. Add Dependency Upgrade Step for Nightly Runs

- Before the dependency installation step, add steps to upgrade all dependencies in `package.json` to their latest versions.
- Use [`npm-check-updates`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/npm-check-updates) (`ncu`) for this purpose.
- Ensure these steps only run for scheduled (nightly) workflows using `if: github.event_name == 'schedule'`.

#### 4. Apply Changes to All Relevant Subprojects

- Repeat this process for every subdirectory in the repository that uses npm/yarn (e.g., `solidity-example/js`, `recursion/js`, `web-starter/web/vite`, `web-starter/web/webpack`, `web-starter/web/nextjs`, etc.).

#### 5. Verify and Monitor

- After implementing the changes, verify that nightly runs use the latest versions of npm dependencies by inspecting workflow logs and generated lockfiles.
- Ensure that tests complete and that any failures are properly reported via the issue creation step.

#### 6. Document the Change

- Add comments to the workflow files or repository documentation to clarify that nightly runs use the latest npm package versions.


**Outcome:**  
Nightly test runs will always use the newest versions of npm dependencies, helping to proactively catch breaking changes or incompatibilities introduced by upstream updates.

summary.main: Update the nightly tests to run against the latest published version of npm packages, rather than the version specified in package.json.

summary.attemptedFixes: The plan involves using `npm-check-updates` (ncu) to upgrade dependencies in package.json to their latest versions, and ensuring these steps only run for scheduled (nightly) workflows using `if: github.event_name == 'schedule'.
summary.otherNotes: This issue aims to update the nightly tests to run against the latest published version of npm packages, rather than the version specified in package.json. The implementation plan involves identifying all nightly workflows, finding JS dependency installation steps, adding a dependency upgrade step for nightly runs, applying changes to all relevant subprojects, verifying and monitoring, and documenting the change.

Add an automated check to every commit of a new pull request for being [signed off](https://git-scm.com/docs/git-commit#Documentation/git-commit.txt---signoff) by the requester.

One possile solution was to include the action [Check PR commits signed off ?? Actions ?? GitHub Marketplace](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/check-pr-commits-signed-off) in the workflow.

issueDTO.title: Question Classifier node click causes "Cannot read properties of null" error during workflow execution
issueDTO.description: ### Self Checks - [x] I have read the [Contributing Guide](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [Language Policy](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/1542). - [x] This is only for bug report, if you would like to ask a question, please head to [Discussions](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/discussions/categories/general). - [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues), including closed ones. - [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report, otherwise it will be closed. - [x] ??????????????? & Non English User????????????????????????????????????????????? ?????? - [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields. ### Dify version 1.7.0 ### Cloud or Self Hosted Self Hosted (Docker) ### Steps to reproduce 1. Set up Dify 1.7.0 using Docker Compose 2. Create a new workflow application 3. Add a Question Classifier node to the workflow 4. Configure the Question Classifier node with: - Input variable selector - Model configuration - Classification classes 5. Start workflow preview/run 6. While the Question Classifier node is in "RUNNING" status, immediately click on the node 7. Error occurs ### ?????? Expected Behavior The Question Classifier node panel should open normally, allowing users to view node configuration and status even during execution. ### ??? Actual Behavior Clicking on the Question Classifier node during workflow execution results in a JavaScript error and the UI becomes unresponsive. The workflow continues to run in the background, but the frontend crashes.
comments:
<!-- Greeting -->
Hi @haotien91! I'm [Dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot) and I???m helping the dify team.

<!-- Answer -->
This error is likely caused by missing null/undefined checks in the frontend code for the Question Classifier node panel. When you click the node during execution, the required state or data may not be available yet, leading to a crash if the component tries to access properties of a null object. This pattern has been seen in other Dify issues and is often resolved by adding robust null guards and error handling in the relevant React components to prevent the UI from crashing if data is missing or in transition ([example](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/16142), [example](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/16173)).

Recent pull requests have improved variable validation and error handling for workflow nodes, but there???s no direct evidence this specific bug is fixed in 1.7.0. Upgrading to the latest version may help, as changes like [#21766](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/pull/21766), [#21932](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/pull/21932), and [#22462](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/pull/22462) have touched related areas. If upgrading isn???t possible, a workaround is to add null checks in the Question Classifier node???s panel/component rendering logic (see `web/app/components/workflow/nodes/_base/components/workflow-panel/index.tsx`) to ensure the UI doesn???t try to access properties of a null object during rapid state changes.

If you have custom modifications, double-check that all node data is initialized before rendering, and consider adding fallback UI or error messages when required data is missing ([reference](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/20725)).


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->
*To reply, just mention [@dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot).*

<sup>How did I do? ## Update: Version Testing Results

I conducted additional testing across different Dify versions and found that this issue is a **regression introduced in v1.6.0**.

### Test Results:
- ??? **v1.5.1 and earlier**: Question Classifier node works normally - can click during execution without errors
- ??? **v1.6.0 and later** (including v1.7.0): Frontend crashes with "Cannot read properties of null (reading 'props')" when clicking Question Classifier node during workflow execution

### Testing Method:
1. Deployed each version using Docker Compose
2. Created identical workflow with Question Classifier node (Based on the DSL provided above)
3. Started workflow preview and clicked the node during RUNNING status
4. Verified the behavior consistently across versions

repository.description: Production-ready platform for agentic workflow development.
repository.name: dify

summary.main: The Question Classifier node click causes 'Cannot read properties of null' error during workflow execution, and the UI becomes unresponsive. The workflow continues to run in the background, but the frontend crashes.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue occurs when the Question Classifier node is clicked in 'RUNNING' status, and the required state or data may not be available yet. The frontend crashes with 'Cannot read properties of null (reading 'props')' when clicking the node during workflow execution.
summary.attemptedFixes: Recent pull requests have improved variable validation and error handling for workflow nodes, but there???s no direct evidence this specific bug is fixed in 1.7.0. Upgrading to the latest version may help, as changes like #21766, #21932, and #22462 have touched related areas. If upgrading isn???t possible, a workaround is to add null checks in the Question Classifier node???s panel/component rendering logic (see `web/app/components/workflow/nodes/_base/components/workflow-panel/index.tsx`) to ensure the UI doesn???t try to access properties of a null object during rapid state changes.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is caused by missing null/undefined checks in the frontend code for the Question Classifier node panel. When the node is clicked during execution, the required state or data may not be available yet, leading to a crash if the component tries to access properties of a null object. This pattern has been seen in other Dify issues and is often resolved by adding robust null guards and error handling in the relevant React components to prevent the UI from crashing if data is missing or in transition.

issueDTO.title: Faster json library?
issueDTO.description:
I was wondering if there exists or were plans to add support for faster Python JSON libraries (e.g. [orjson](https://github.com/ijl/orjson), [rapidjson](https://github.com/python-rapidjson/python-rapidjson)) instead of using the standard Python JSON library for serialization and deserialization. Based on [benchmarks](https://pythonspeed.com/articles/faster-json-library/), it seems like a more performant json library could have a significant effect on throughput for JSON-encoded Kafka messages. 

I tried searching the repo and past issues before posting this but wasn't able to find anything.
comments: This is a good idea for quick perf wins

issueDTO.title: Unable to create VST3 with PlugType::kFxAnalyzer.
issueDTO.description:
Hey all,

Plug-ins with the feature `CLAP_PLUGIN_FEATURE_ANALYZER` do not show in Audacity due to it only allowing VST3s of type `PlugType::kFx` to show in the insert effects list. Bitwig, Live, and Reaper are fine with `PlugType::kAnalyzer` being inserted in their effects lists, but the comment describing `kAnalyzer` in ivstaudioprocessor.h says "not selectable as insert plug-in".

CLAP's documentation is not so specific about if the plug-in can be an insert or not, but it has me wondering if `CLAP_PLUGIN_FEATURE_ANALYZER` would be better mapped to `PlugType::kFxAnalyzer`?
comments:
`CLAP_PLUGIN_FEATURE_ANALYZER` is already mapped to `PlugType::kFxAnalyzer`: https://github.com/free-audio/clap-wrapper/blob/5ba58f16a7816085d46cb8b7bb40b1eb1d9561d2/src/detail/vst3/categories.cpp#L64

Do you mean it should be mapped to `kFx`?

Actually, I am not sure. The question is two-fold:
- Why is the VST3 const so specific not to be in an insert?
- Do we loose anything by changing that mapping (like: it is not being listed anymore in a analyzer category)?
To me it looks to me like it's mapped to `kAnalyzer`, not `kFxAnalyzer`. The resulting string that the VST3 host reads is `"Analyzer"` rather than `"Fx|Analyzer"`.

https://github.com/free-audio/clap-wrapper/blob/48e3859ab2494bcfcabb874b76c5693a3c6ce5c8/src/detail/vst3/categories.cpp#L64

For more detail. In my plug-in, if I mark it as an analyzer like so:

```c++
static constexpr const char * features[] = {
    CLAP_PLUGIN_FEATURE_ANALYZER,
    CLAP_PLUGIN_FEATURE_STEREO,
    nullptr,
}
```

Bitwig shows "Analysis" for the category for the VST3 and CLAP versions, but Audacity doesn't allow it to be inserted and the VST3PluginTestHost shows "Analyzer" for the SubCat, but also no longer allows me to insert it into its effects list.

If I mark it like so:
```c++
static constexpr const char * features[] = {
    CLAP_PLUGIN_FEATURE_ANALYZER,
    CLAP_PLUGIN_FEATURE_AUDIO_EFFECT, // swapping this with the line above has no affect to the behavior
    CLAP_PLUGIN_FEATURE_STEREO,
    nullptr,
}
```

Bitwig shows "Audio FX" for the category on both VST3 and CLAP versions. The resulting SubCat is "Analyzer|Fx" (regardless of order). I only just now noticed that it does insert both the category and subcategory but in the wrong order. However, if that behavior was fixed the CLAP plug-in would still not show the Analyzer category.
Hm, we will try to figure this out. In the meantime you can also implement CLAP_PLUGIN_FACTORY_INFO_VST3 where you can override all VST3 options, also the feature string.
ok, the VST3 SDK lists:
```c++
SMTG_CONSTEXPR const CString kFxAnalyzer			= "Fx|Analyzer";	///< Scope, FFT-Display, Loudness Processing...
//...
SMTG_CONSTEXPR const CString kAnalyzer			    = "Analyzer";	    ///< Meter, Scope, FFT-Display, not selectable as insert plug-in
```

So essentially, if `Fx` is missing, it shouldn't be in an insert - why ever this should be desirable.
In this case, I think we should map it to kFxAnalyzer. The function `clapCategoriesToVST3` must be adapted a bit since it does not support the `|`inside, it also does not sort `Fx` before `Analyzer` . It just sorts them alphabetically - which should be okay according to the VST3 SDK, but hosts.. *sigh* 

So, yes, this needs a bit of tweaking.
> Hm, we will try to figure this out. In the meantime you can also implement CLAP_PLUGIN_FACTORY_INFO_VST3 where you can override all VST3 options, also the feature string.

Thank you for the advice. I had not seen that prior and this is working great in the meantime.

issueDTO.title: [Contributions Welcome] Add Fast Image Processors
issueDTO.description:
## Community contributions: Add Fast Image Processors

Fast image processors have been rolling out progressively for a while. Now that the [BaseImageProcessorFast](https://github.com/huggingface/transformers/blob/main/src/transformers/image_processing_utils_fast.py#L292), from which all fast image processors inherit, is in a more stable state, I'm opening this issue to encourage contributors to add fast image processors for models that still only have a "slow" image processor.

### How to implement a Fast Image Processor

The core principle of fast image processors is to use `torch` and `torchvision` functions for image transformations instead of `PIL` or `numpy`. Among other performance benefits, this enables processing images on GPU, significantly improving inference speed.

Another key difference compared to slow image processors is that, unlike `BaseImageProcessor`, which provides only a minimal skeleton, `BaseImageProcessorFast` includes all the fundamental functionalities needed for a basic image processor. This allows optimizations made in BaseImageProcessorFast to propagate to its inherited classes. Additionally, most repetitive logic for image loading and argument handling is managed within BaseImageProcessorFast. Except in rare cases, inherited classes do not need to handle image loading, conversion, or retrieving arguments from class attributes in the call/preprocess function, this is all handled in `BaseImageProcessorFast`.

#### Getting Started

Run the following command:
```bash
transformers-cli add-fast-image-processor --model-name model_name
```
where `model_name` is the name of the model (as found in its folder under `transformers/src/transformers/models`) for which you're adding the fast image processor.

This command will handle all necessary imports and generate a basic fast image processor, which will look similar to this example for Beit:

```python
# coding=utf-8
# Copyright 2025 The HuggingFace Inc. team. All rights reserved.
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.
"""Fast Image processor class for Beit."""

from ...image_processing_utils_fast import BASE_IMAGE_PROCESSOR_FAST_DOCSTRING, BaseImageProcessorFast
from ...image_utils import IMAGENET_STANDARD_MEAN, IMAGENET_STANDARD_STD, PILImageResampling
from ...utils import add_start_docstrings


@add_start_docstrings(
    "Constructs a fast Beit image processor.",
    BASE_IMAGE_PROCESSOR_FAST_DOCSTRING,
)
class BeitImageProcessorFast(BaseImageProcessorFast):
    # This generated class can be used as a starting point for the fast image processor.
    # if the image processor is only used for simple augmentations, such as resizing, center cropping, rescaling, or normalizing,
    # only the default values should be set in the class.
    # If the image processor requires more complex augmentations, methods from BaseImageProcessorFast can be overridden.
    # In most cases, only the `_preprocess` method should be overridden.

    # For an example of a fast image processor requiring more complex augmentations, see `LlavaNextImageProcessorFast`.

    # Default values should be checked against the slow image processor
    # None values left after checking can be removed
    resample = PILImageResampling.BICUBIC
    image_mean = IMAGENET_STANDARD_MEAN
    image_std = IMAGENET_STANDARD_STD
    size = {"height": 256, "width": 256}
    default_to_square = None
    crop_size = {"height": 224, "width": 224}
    do_resize = True
    do_center_crop = True
    do_rescale = True
    do_normalize = True
    do_convert_rgb = None


__all__ = ["BeitImageProcessorFast"]
```

As explained in the generated file, if the image processor only performs basic augmentations such as resizing, center cropping, rescaling, and normalizing, the generated file might be sufficient for a working fast image processor. The class attributes, such as `resample` and `image_mean`, are automatically parsed from the slow image processor when running the script above. However, you should verify their correctness and check for any missing or incorrectly assigned values.

### Customizing the Image Processor

If the image processor requires additional functionalities beyond the basic augmentations, you will need to override the `_preprocess` function in `BaseImageProcessorFast`. Check the `_preprocess` implementation in `BaseImageProcessorFast` for reference. Notably, it leverages `group_images_by_shape` and `reorder_images` to enable batch processing, significantly increasing processing speed, particularly on GPUs. If you create new image processing functions, ensure they support batch processing by utilizing `group_images_by_shape` and `reorder_images` where possible.

If your image processor requires additional kwargs not present in [`DefaultFastImageProcessorKwargs`](https://github.com/huggingface/transformers/blob/main/src/transformers/image_processing_utils_fast.py#L172), you must create a `ModelNameFastImageProcessorKwargs` class that inherits from `DefaultFastImageProcessorKwargs` and defines the new kwargs. Additionally, you should document the added kwargs in the class and the `preprocess` function using `add_start_docstrings`. (This documentation process may be simplified soon, but is necessary for now to get a correct documentation).

For an example of handling custom kwargs and documentation, refer to [LlavaNextImageProcessorFast](https://github.com/huggingface/transformers/blob/main/src/transformers/models/llava_next/image_processing_llava_next_fast.py).

### Important Notes

- In nearly all cases, `_preprocess` is the only function in `BaseImageProcessorFast` that needs to be overridden.
- The `_preprocess` function does not require default values for its arguments, as they are automatically derived from class attributes if not explicitly provided.
- Even if `PIL` images or `numpy` arrays are passed to the image processor, the `images` argument in `_preprocess` will always be a list of tensors, with the channel dimension first.

### Handling Edge Cases

- **Nested Images:** If images are provided as nested lists (e.g., `[[image1, image2], [image3]]`), they will be flattened to `[image1, image2, image3]` by default before being passed to `_preprocess`. This behavior can be modified by overriding `_prepare_images_structure`, though flattening is generally recommended.
- **Formatting Custom  Kwargs:** If any custom kwargs require formatting before `_preprocess`, override `_further_process_kwargs`.
- **Validating Custom Kwargs:** If additional validation is needed for custom kwargs or existing ones, override `_validate_preprocess_kwargs`.

### Testing

In the case where the model already has a `test_image_processing_model_name.py` file under `transformers/tests/models/model_name`, the script ran before should have imported the fast image processor to the file, and added it as a `fast_image_processing_class` class attribute to the `ModelNameImageProcessingTest` class.
However this is not enough to get all the tests to run on the fast image processor. For all the test functions under `ModelNameImageProcessingTest`, you need to replace `image_processing = self.image_processing_class(**self.image_processor_dict)` with a loop over `self.image_processor_list`.

For example, the `test_image_processor_properties` test in `test_image_processing_beit.py` which looks like this:

```python
    def test_image_processor_properties(self):
        image_processing = self.image_processing_class(**self.image_processor_dict)
        self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "do_resize"))
        self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "size"))
        self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "do_center_crop"))
        self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "center_crop"))
        self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "do_normalize"))
        self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "image_mean"))
        self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "image_std"))
        self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "do_reduce_labels"))
```
should be changed to this:

```python
    def test_image_processor_properties(self):
        for image_processing_class in self.image_processor_list:
            image_processing = image_processing_class(**self.image_processor_dict)
            self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "do_resize"))
            self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "size"))
            self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "do_center_crop"))
            self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "center_crop"))
            self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "do_normalize"))
            self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "image_mean"))
            self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "image_std"))
            self.assertTrue(hasattr(image_processing, "do_reduce_labels"))
```

In the case where no image processing test file is present, now is a great time to add one! You can have a look at the[ CLIP image processing test file](https://github.com/huggingface/transformers/blob/ad5d40de9c4d4899d5b79243f63e22c72e8b3669/tests/models/clip/test_image_processing_clip.py) to use as a simple starting point.

Don't hesitate to add model-specific tests if you feel like there are some non-standard image processing techniques in the processor :).

To run the tests, use this command:
```bash
RUN_SLOW=1 python -m pytest tests/models/model_name/test_image_processing_model_name.py
```


### Choosing an Image Processor to Implement

The difficulty of implementing a fast image processor varies by model. If this is your first issue, consider starting with an easier one!

Happy coding!

comments: Hey! I'd like to work on this issue with **MobileViT** 😊

@yonigozlan have you considered adopting [`kornia`](https://github.com/kornia/kornia) for that ? we have been curating algorithms (+700 ops) already for several years in terms of image processing and low level vision using exclusively pytorch.
I would love to pick one and start contributing. Good task for this week..!

@edgarriba I love kornia! But for image processors at inference time, it might be a bit overkill since 90% of the time, we only need a mix of resizing, normalizing, padding, and cropping, combined with some model-specific logic. I???ve found that `torch`/`torchvision` functional transforms usually cover these needs well, and pipelines like kornia `ImageSequential` or torchvision `Compose` aren???t always a good fit because some models require additional processing steps or custom logic in between. We also wanted to avoid adding an extra dependency to Transformers for fast image processors.

That said, I do think kornia could be valuable down the line, especially for batch processing. I'm still exploring how to optimize batch processing performance on both GPU and CPU, and kornia likely handles this more efficiently than our current approach.

The core of the library is pure functional -- that has been always the scope. The top layers you mention were added later just for commodity just for the case of augmentations but big part of the library has been designed as free functions for the exact purposes you mention. In any case, we are always open to collaborations and improvements.

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to add fast image processors for various models. The fast image processor is a more efficient version of the slow image processor and is used for image processing tasks. The fast image processor must be able to process images correctly and efficiently and must be tested thoroughly.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The fast image processor must be able to process images correctly and efficiently. It must also be able to handle various image formats and sizes. The fast image processor must be tested thoroughly to ensure it works correctly.
summary.attemptedFixes: Some contributors have already attempted to implement fast image processors for various models, but some PRs are still open or have been closed due to issues. Contributors are encouraged to take on models that are still unassigned or have open PRs.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is about adding fast image processors for various models. The fast image processor is a more efficient version of the slow image processor. The fast image processor uses Torch and Torchvision functions for image transformations, which enables processing images on GPU, improving inference speed. The fast image processor is more complex and requires more custom code than the slow image processor. The fast image processor also requires more testing to ensure it works correctly. The issue is open to anyone who wants to contribute to adding fast image processors for various models.

issueDTO.title: Fix false assumptions in 'build_docker_worker_payload'
issueDTO.description:
We call `util.docker.parse_volumes` in the `build_docker_worker_payload` function
https://github.com/taskcluster/taskgraph/blob/4f589d8ff995f90becb53d3841ac701da1afc662/src/taskgraph/transforms/task.py#L578

This in turn makes several false assumptions, namely that the root dir is `taskcluster/ci` and that there exists a kind called `docker-image`:
https://github.com/taskcluster/taskgraph/blob/4f589d8ff995f90becb53d3841ac701da1afc662/src/taskgraph/util/docker.py#L15
https://github.com/taskcluster/taskgraph/blob/4f589d8ff995f90becb53d3841ac701da1afc662/src/taskgraph/util/docker.py#L211

Neither of these things are necessarily true. Rather than re-parsing the docker image's `kind.yml` file, we should store the path to the Dockerfile as an attribute (or tag) on the docker image task. Then we should move the check from the first link to a "verification" in `util/verify.py`. This way we'll be able to access the path to the Dockerfile directly from the dependency.
comments:
Oops, I didn't use permalinks and the urls above were all wrong. Just fixed them.

To re-phrase this bug a bit, the problem is in the last two links. For example, in that last one we have `load_yaml("taskcluster", "kinds", "docker-image", "kind.yml")`. The root directory (`taskcluster`) is just a convention, so the fact that we're hardcoding it here, means any repo that has it configured in a non-standard place is going to break.

The kind name (`docker-image`) is also just a convention, so if a repo uses a different kind name for their docker-images, this will also break.

repository.description: Generates task dependency graphs for Taskcluster CI
repository.name: taskgraph

summary.main: Fix false assumptions in 'build_docker_worker_payload' function
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires the root dir and kind name to be configurable and not hardcoded
summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the issue description
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about false assumptions in 'build_docker_worker_payload' function, specifically about root dir and kind name in docker-image, and it's suggested to store path to Dockerfile as attribute or tag on docker image task and move check to 'util/verify.py'.

issueDTO.title: Snap to East South Up blueprint node in construction script crashes the editor.
issueDTO.description:
### What happened?

If you reference the globeanchor and try to snap to east south up and you do not have the blueprint in the level but you try to open the blueprint, the editor will crash.

### Environment

Cesium for Unreal version: 2.13.3
Unreal Engine Version: 5.4
Operating System: Windows 11


### Reproduction steps

1. Create blueprint with cesium globe anchor component
2. In the construction script, reference globe anchor and set actor rotation to snap to east south up node output.
3. Close blueprint window
4. Drop actor in the level and it should snap to east south up as intended.
5. Create a new level.
6. Open new level.
7. Try to open the blueprint without putting it in the level.
8. Construction script fires but since the actor is not in the scene it is unable to get a georeference and crashes the editor.
9. ...

### Supporting evidence

The image below is the code I was using in my construction script.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0cd222e2-d01f-4f7c-a3fe-23fac305653c)
comments: Thanks for writing this up @RoeDefense2!

I can reproduce this issue still, though I had to alter the workflow a bit. The crash didn't happen until I closed Unreal, re-opened it and then opened the Blueprint in a new level. 

Also linking to forum post here: https://community.cesium.com/t/snap-to-east-south-up-blueprint-node-in-construction-script-crashes-the-editor/38932

repository.description: Bringing the 3D geospatial ecosystem to Unreal Engine
repository.name: cesium-unreal

summary.main: The editor crashes when trying to snap to East South Up blueprint node in construction script without having the blueprint in the level.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Unreal Engine Version: 5.4, Operating System: Windows 11, Cesium for Unreal version: 2.13.3
summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the issue description
summary.otherNotes: The issue is reproducible by creating a blueprint with a globe anchor component, referencing it in the construction script, closing the blueprint window, dropping the actor in the level, creating a new level, opening the new level, and trying to open the blueprint without putting it in the level.

issueDTO.description: ## Overview We'd like to update the Now view, i.e. https://openlibrary.org/trending/now should be updated so instead of saying "someone" marked book as [state] it instead shows their avatar and username as a link, perhaps with a button next to it to follow them, similar to #9415. ## Context * This builds off #6014 (see what files are involved), where we implemented a Trending page to show what books are being logged Now, this Month, etc. ## Designs **Before:** **After?** perhaps something closer to: ## Instructions **Before asking to be assigned**, you can help by proposing a 🎨 design for this feature or asking any clarifying questions you may have. Thank you! ?????? Also, if you're a new contributor, please [run these commands](https://github.com/internetarchive/openlibrary/wiki/Git-Cheat-Sheet#working-on-your-branch) to ensure your repository is up to date **before** [creating a new branch](https://github.com/internetarchive/openlibrary/wiki/Git-Cheat-Sheet#making-changes-and-creating-a-pull-request) to work on this issue and **each time after** pushing code to Github, because the pre-commit bot may add commits to your PRs upstream. ### Justification The trending page is interesting but misses an opportunity enable patrons to discover deeper insights by exploring other books the patron may recommend, or by allowing them to be followed. This may be a good first step in making our Follow feature useful. ## Research > Are there any precedents or findings from other projects or studies that support this feature? (link or screenshot if possible) Goodreads does something similar ### Breakdown #### Requirements Checklist * Designs should be **consistent** with how patron avatars appear elsewhere on the site, use existing css where possible (e.g. the My Books feed page!) see #8607 + #9415 * Designs should contain avatar, username (as link) and a small blue button to "Follow" the patron -- you might take inspiration from https://openlibrary.org/people/mekBot/books/feed * Patron privacy must be respected -- only show patron if their reading log setting is public. #### Related files * See #6014: https://github.com/internetarchive/openlibrary/pull/6014/files#diff-b352027e4688f5ef14e5e23f6a988bba495e769f8cecce80c404a23d82f5902a * See My Books Feed designs (e.g. https://openlibrary.org/people/mekBot/books/feed) Implemented by #8607 in https://github.com/internetarchive/openlibrary/pull/8607/files#diff-1c0a702d7b1bad810adce7c001416b5996968d117077f629ff52ddff4668f56fR45-R51
comments:
Hi @mekarpeles,

Such a nice idea Mek, I???d love to work on this! Here???s my approach:

->I???ll create a mockup to display the patron???s avatar, username as a link, and a Follow button. I???ll ensure the design matches the current style of the site, especially following the look of the My Books feed page, and I'll make sure to use existing CSS where possible.
->I???ll update the backend to fetch public patron data (only if their reading log is public).
->On the frontend, I???ll add the patron???s avatar, make the username a clickable link, and include a small "Follow" button. It will be  consistent with the existing follow functionality, ensuring patrons can easily follow others.

And then for the testing, 
->After implementation, I???ll run tests for responsiveness, cross-browser compatibility, and edge cases like empty avatars or usernames. I???ll also check for smoothness with the follow feature.

This feature can help patrons discover more books through people they follow, and really could be the first step toward building social features on Open Library.

Let me know if you have any feedback or suggestions! 😊

Hi @SharkyBytes! Thanks for these details.

> I???ll update the backend to fetch public patron data (only if their reading log is public).

It's _possible_ this part is done already! Or, I think we should take the approach of leaving it anonymous (if their reading log is private) and **otherwise** showing the new design. In either case, these two modes / design should hopefully be fairly consistent with each other.

Looking forward to seeing your designs and we can bring them for feedback to either our Tuesday or Friday community calls!

Here's one design that standardizes the `Catalog Card` from the search results page with `Events` that might appear on the `Feed` or `Trending Now` page(s) It proposes creating an augmented, extended version of the `Catalog Card` called a `Catalog Card Event`. This would replace the current Trending Now card and make things a bit more standardized. ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4308be87-6d53-410a-9d90-51b20fddca6c) It's at least something we can work towards in the meantime (and then discuss designs further). I think it will be important to develop things modularly such that the `Event` section can be reused in multiple contexts and that a `Catalog Card Event` component can be composed (as a template) by rendering a top `Event` section and then a `Catalog Card` (i.e. macro/SearchResultWork) below it.
@SharkyBytes are you still working on this?
Yeah, @ananyakaligal, I???m working on this. It???s almost done. I just need to check it with Mek now.

Happy to provide a review when it's ready, thanks for working on this. Thanks for the offer to help @ananyakaligal! I'll followup on slack and see if we can work together to find a themed set of high impact issues to tackle together.

Hi @mekarpeles,

I???m currently working on this issue and am excited to start my contribution journey. I wanted to share an update with you and seek your advice.

Here???s what I???ve accomplished so far:

1. Successfully fetched the patron data.
2. Added the follow button.
3. Updated the underlined username link to redirect to the patron???s profile.
4. Ensured the "Want to Read" link navigates correctly to the patron???s "Want to Read" section.

Let me know if you???d like any adjustments to these features!

That said, I???m currently facing an issue with implementing the follow functionality (so the follow button works as expected). I???m actively working on resolving this, but if you have any suggestions, resources, or pointers that could save me from searching through the full codebase, it would be a huge help.

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

Current Implementation :-

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cdcd0ca5-b777-4744-b059-803bcac9e393)

@SharkyBytes great work so far:
* Let's try to make the follow button follow the same type of style and classes as the rest of our buttons (e.g. consistent color and border-radius).
* For the follow button, you may wish to consult the **Feed** https://openlibrary.org/people/mekBot/books/feed referenced in the original post, which uses the `Follow` macro: https://github.com/internetarchive/openlibrary/blob/master/openlibrary/macros/Follow.html


## What to do if a patron is not logged in?

This case is actually almost completely handled for us already by the `Follow` macro.

If a visitor navigates to the `/trending/now` page, the `Follow` macro will **already** show a real `Follow` button if they're logged in:
https://github.com/internetarchive/openlibrary/pull/8607/files#diff-f8a08ee2ccd19673120d20e7bb9a9bb0522f49eed20aa98edd0007787058c302R7

And if they're not logged in, an `else` condition will ensure the visitor get a `Follow` button that routes the visitor to login: 
https://github.com/internetarchive/openlibrary/pull/8607/files#diff-f8a08ee2ccd19673120d20e7bb9a9bb0522f49eed20aa98edd0007787058c302R16-R17

The `Follow` macro is built so that in this login case, a special request variable `ctx.path` (i.e. the current url of the page we're rendering) is computed, so that whatever page calls it can be  preserved by passing it along to the login endpoint request as a URL parameter called `?redir_url`, so after the patron logs in, they can be redirected back to the page they came from. In this case, `ctx.path` would know we're on the `/trending` page and so the login redirect will happen for us automatically.

## Opportunity

One caveat of this flow is, by logging in, we're not actually completing the `Follow` the patron requested! They have to click `Follow`, login, go back to `/trending` and figure out that they have to click `Follow` again, which is both non-intuitive and may be difficult as the `/trending` page changes from moment to moment and so the person they were trying to follow may not be on the page anymore! 🤦 

I'm considering this a **separate**, followup issue tracked here (which has a volunteer: @ShilpThapak):
* #10338

Hey @mekarpeles,

I'm encountering an issue with the local instance of Open Library. I???ve set all reading activity to private, as shown in the image below. However, when I add books to the "Want to Read" section from my personal account, the system still displays my name and the section I added the book to. While the "Want to Read" link itself is protected (I can't view the detailed logs), it still reveals who added the book and where.

As we discussed earlier, the expected behavior should be to display something like "Someone added to Want to Read" instead of showing the user's name and activity details. Am I right?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fe39d381-a8dd-40c2-9348-c27a164d98b2)

I???ve also tried debugging the entry, but I???m unsure which field determines whether the reading logs are private. In the entry, I noticed that both openlibrary and personal show None for the private field, which seems to indicate no restrictions. Could you clarify which field controls this behavior and if there's a potential issue with the logic handling privacy settings?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/046cebfd-d268-40fd-bf14-584a9c471342)

Also, @mekarpeles, I noticed another issue regarding avatars. As shown in the image below, the avatar isn???t displaying because the ` /people/test_username/avatar` redirects to the main archive site and shows "Item not available."

I had a detailed discussion about this with @scottbarnes, who was incredibly helpful. However, we???re now uncertain whether we should display a default avatar when no profile picture is available or if we should simply leave the avatar blank.

Would love your thoughts on this!

You'll need to fetch the patrons privacy value from their account setting object (you should be able to perform a get_many on all the patrons in one page) and conditionally load their name / follow buttons, etc. there may also be a private book on the reading log entry

We should use a default avatar if private 

We can do the following to get a mapping of patrons to their privacy:
```
usernames = ['mekBot', 'ScarTissue', 'seabelis', 'brewster', 'jachamp']
user_prefs = web.ctx.site.get_many([f'/people/{username}/preferences' for username in usernames])
followable = dict((user.key.split('/')[2], user.notifications.public_readlog == 'yes') for user in user_prefs)
```

@SharkyBytes are you still working on this?

If not, @mekarpeles Can I work on this?
Hi, I'd love to work on this issue!

@SharkyBytes, it seems like you've done a bit of work on this issue. Do you still plan to work on it? Otherwise, do you think you can push up the code you've worked on so far so others can help take the feature over the finish line and your commits still get included in the final result?
@ragipidavid would you like to try this one? :)

issueDTO.title: Show error notification when GraphQL query returned partial failure
issueDTO.description:
Since `v0.226.0`, the sidecar can return partial data/failure responses for GraphQL queries (https://github.com/confluentinc/ide-sidecar/pull/461).

The extension should update to this or a newer sidecar release and start notifying users about partial failures. When, for instance, fetching Flink Compute Pools has failed, the extension could notify the user about it but continue rendering other resources, like Kafka clusters.

issueDTO.title: Add an option to automatically add missing versions on exported packages
issueDTO.description:
If packages are exported without a version this can be problematic, it would be good to have an option in the "Organize Manifest" Wizard to add missing package version on exports, so it can be applied in batch to many projects and in combination with the new [tycho-cleancode:manifest](https://tycho.eclipseprojects.io/doc/main/tycho-cleancode-plugin/manifest-mojo.html) mojo.

A user likely wants to have the following options:

1. Use a fixed version (defaults to 1.0.0)
2. Using the current bundle version
comments:
Hello,

My team and I would love to work on adding this feature to the project. We will be working on this issue to add the options you have suggested.
@Vonna9 I'm unassigned no from the issue due to inactivity, if you like to further proceed here please open a PR to show your current state of work so we can further help you here.

Hello @laeubi, My teammate @hilla-ryy and I are still working on the issue #1815. We ran into a few issues importing a forked version of the repository into Eclipse IDE for committers and have provided some of the errors we encountered in the Q&A Discussion: https://github.com/eclipse-pde/eclipse.pde/discussions/1878. We would be happy to open a Pull Request soon to share our current state of work. So far, we have been reviewing the codebase and creating a plan for how we are going to add the missing package versions to exports. To make sure we are on the right track, we would like to verify with you a plan we created based on our understanding of the codebase. We plan on: 1. Adding a checkbox button to the **Organize Manifests Wizard Page.java** file that says "add missing package versions on exports" and two check box options to either ???use a fixed version (defaults to 1.0.0)??? or ???using the current bundle version???. 2. Editing the **Organize_Manifests.html** file to specify the options we added to the Organize Manifests Wizard Page. 3. Editing code in the **Organize Manifest Settings.java** file to add our new ???add missing version packages to exports??? as an available setting. 4. Editing code in **Organize Manifests Processor.java file** to add an if statement case to check if the file being exported is missing a package version. We can use a Boolean value in case there are no missing package versions. 5. Editing code in the **Organize Manifest.java** file to write a function that adds the missing package version for exports based on whether the user checked that they wanted a fixed version or a current bundle version. In the code we can reference from **ExportPackageObject.java** and use the versionAttribute or a custom object to assign the packages with the correct versions. Otherwise we assign a default version. Wizard Preview: This is a preview of what the **Organize Manifest Wizard** may look like with the options to add missing package versions to exports; it will have separate options where the user can choose adding ???fixed versions to exported packages??? or using the ???current bundle version???. We referred to the documentation of the organize manifest wizard from the Eclipse PDE page so that the options we add match the exact design of the Organize Manifest Wizard: https://help.eclipse.org/latest/index.jsp?topic=%2Forg.eclipse.pde.doc.user%2Fguide%2Ftools%2Fpde_actions%2Forganize_manifests.htm Based on the current codebase for the organized manifest wizard, is our current plan for adding missing package versions on exports on the right track? Also, how may we include the tycho-cleancode:manifest to adding the correct versions of exported packages within the Organize Manifest Settings.java file? Thank you for allowing us to work on this issue. We are working hard to add the options you suggested. Have a wonderful day.

Your plan generally sounds good.

> 1. Adding a checkbox button to the **Organize Manifests Wizard Page.java** file that says "add missing package versions on exports" and two check box options to either ???use a fixed version (defaults to 1.0.0)??? or ???using the current bundle version???.

In case a the fixed-version option is selected, you should probably also enable a text-box so that one can enter another version than the default.

> We would be happy to open a Pull Request soon to share our current state of work.

Yes, please do so. You can also open a PR as draft if it's not yet fully completed. It's often easier to discuss implementations with some (preliminary) code-changes than just abstractly in an issue.


> Also, how may we include the tycho-cleancode:manifest to adding the correct versions of exported packages within the Organize Manifest Settings.java file?

You don't have to worry about that part, that's another tool (i.e. a Plugin for Maven)

issueDTO.title: Opinfo testing for python frontend
issueDTO.description:
This issue tracks opinfo testing for various operations in the python frontend. The goal is to find any corner cases and test for error conditions.

## Unary
- [x] ceil, floor, frac, neg, bitwise_not, trunc, reciprocal, round

#### Bool
- [x] isfinite, isinf, isnan, isneginf, isposinf, isreal, signbit

#### Float
- [x] abs, acos, acosh, asin, asinh, atan, atanh, cos, cosh, erf, erfc, erfcinv, erfinv, exp, exp2, expm1, lgamma, log, log10, log1p, log2, reciprocal, rsqrt, sign, sin, sinh, sqrt, tan, tanh

## Binary
#### Float
- [x] atan2, truediv

#### Float-Only
- [x]  nextafter

#### Cast-Integers-to-Float
- [x]  add, ceildiv, div, fmod, mod, mul, pow, remainder, sub

#### Bitwise
- [x]  and, or, xor

#### Int-Only
- [x]  bitwise_left_shift, bitwise_right_shift, logical_right_shift, gcd

#### Compare
- [x]  eq, ge, gt, le, lt, ne

## Ternary
- [ ]  lerp

#### Binary - Alpha
- [ ]  add-alpha, sub-alpha

#### Ternary-Alpha
- [ ]  add-cmul

#### Ternary - Conditional
- [x] where

#### Threshold
- [ ] clamp
- [ ] threshold

## Tensor Creation
- [ ] full
- [ ] iota

## Transformation
- [ ] cast

## Shape
- [x] broadcast
- [x] broadcast-in-dims
- [x] cat
- [x] gather
- [x] index-select
- [x] pad
- [x] permute
- [x] reshape
- [x] slice
- [x] take-along-axis

## Reduction
- [x] max
- [x] min
- [x] prod
- [x] sum

## Normalization

- [x] batch-norm
- [x] variance
- [x] variance-mean

## Random
- [ ] uniform
- [ ] normal

## Matrix-Multiplication
- NN, NT, TN, TT
comments:
Known Issues:

- [ ] https://github.com/NVIDIA/Fuser/issues/427
- [ ] `define_tensor` does not adhere to nvfuser max tensor size. The limit is currently 8 dimensions.
- [ ] Do not downcast back to original dtype after upcasting to `float32` from `bfloat16` or `float16`
- [ ] `broadcast_in_dim` error check: `a[idx] == 1 OR a[idx] == output_shape[new_idx]`
- [ ] `gather` and `take-along-axis` error checks: 
1. Index tensor can only be int or long dtypes.
2. Out-of-bounds index value.
3. Expected dimension of index tensor to be smaller than input tensor except for specified axis.
4. Input and Indices tensors should have the same number of dimensions.
- [ ] https://github.com/NVIDIA/Fuser/issues/521 
- [x] For the `pad` operation, check that the tensor argument and pad value have the same dtype.
@rdspring1 Is this still relevant?
I didn't finish adding the opinfo for the remaining operations. Since opinfo testing is being actively used, somebody probably should.

issueDTO.title: Specifying the splash screen via osgi.splashLocation
issueDTO.description:
Looks like the PDE launcher adds an -showSplash parameter which presents me from using osgi.splashLocation or my own -showSplash parameter with the splash location.

I specify for example -osgi.splashLocation=platform:/plugin/test/splash2.bmp as program argument or -showSplash platform:/plugin/test/splash2.bmp but the value is ignore.

Here is my command line:

-os ${target.os} -ws ${target.ws} -arch ${target.arch} -nl ${target.nl} -consoleLog -clearPersistedState -osgi.splashLocation=platform:/plugin/test/splash2.bmp 

Putting a break point into org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main line 1586 (splashLocation = args[i];) I see that -showsplash is added with 600.

Hi Everyone, I was able to reproduce the behavior that the original author reported with my team (@Dtran048,@kujoon226), PDE ignores the -osgi.splashLocation argument when launching. Here???s a high-level summary of what I did and how I worked around it: **Environment setup** - Installed Eclipse PDE and verified all plug-in dependencies resolve correctly. - Created a simple plug-in project named "test" and added a custom splash image at test/splash2.bmp. - Verified the issue - Launched with arguments: -os ${target.os} -ws ${target.ws} -arch ${target.arch} -nl ${target.nl} -consoleLog -clearPersistedState -osgi.splashLocation=platform:/plugin/test/splash2.bmp Confirmed that -showSplash 600 was honored but the splash image location was ignored. **I found a Workaround via .product file** to be able to display my custom splash screen. - Created test.product in the plug-in project and configured: - Product ID: test.product - Defining plug-in: test - Application: org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench - Contents: added test - Splash tab: added plug-in test - Discovered PDE only recognizes a file named splash.bmp at the root of the selected plug-in, it won???t let you choose a different filename or path. (if you attempt splash2.bmp it'll not show any splash screen, not even default). Fix for **workaround**: - Renamed splash2.bmp ??? splash.bmp in the root of the test plug-in. - Launched again and my custom splash now displays as expected. Assumption: Eclipse???s product???branding UI only ever looks for a file called???splash.bmp in the plug???in you point it at. It doesn???t let you pick an arbitrary filename, everything is hard???wired to the ???splash.bmp??? convention. That???s why renaming your image to splash2.bmp won???t work through the PDE product editor.

As for debugging I've also tried Window -> Perspective -> Open Perspective and "Debug".

@Dtran048,@kujoon226

All the **System Properties** should be specified using a **VM** argument (not a problem argument) with ``` -D= ``` Of course the Program args there are valid and some things should be passed as problem args, but the help documentation describing the System Properties must be passed a system properties. And this determines what's launched with this as the default: And you can check what has been launched via the Help -> About -> Installation Details -> Plug-ins tab.

Please also note that there are [two system properties](https://help.eclipse.org/latest/topic/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/reference/misc/runtime-options.html?cp=2_1_6_0) (**not program arguments** as @merks pointed out and seem to be used as such by @vogella )

> `osgi.splashLocation`
>     **the absolute URL location of the splash screen (.bmp file) to to show while starting Eclipse.** This property overrides any value set in [osgi.splashPath](https://help.eclipse.org/latest/topic/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/reference/misc/runtime-options.html#osgisplashpath).
> `osgi.splashPath`
>     **a comma separated list of URLs to search for a file called splash.bmp**. This property is overriden by any value set in [osgi.splashLocation](https://help.eclipse.org/latest/topic/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/reference/misc/runtime-options.html#osgisplashlocation).

so while the first only accepts ONE **absolute** URL (e.g. if you don't like any on the ones provided with your app and want to use something on your harddisk) the second only ever searches for `splash.bmp` (so you do not give it a name but a basepath).

Also please note that nowhere is says in the documentation that if `-showSplash` (**program argument!**) is specified what takes precedence there if any of the others are specified.

Thanks @merks and @laeubi for the clarification! 
Your explanation really helped me understand the distinction between **VM arguments** (`-Dkey=value`) and **program arguments**, and how that impacts system properties like `osgi.splashLocation`.

Any guidance would be appreciated 

Thanks in advance!
