issueDTO.title: Support documenting tuple return value elements individually
comments: Hey @d-ronnqvist , I would like to work on this. Since this is my first issue, could you point me to the relevant code I should look at?

Absolutely. Here are a few places to start with:

- [`TaggedListItemExtractor.visitListItem(_:)`][tag] is where DocC parses the markup in to a list of [`Return`][ret] structures, as well as all the other list items like parameters, throws, etc.

- [`ReturnsSectionTranslator`][render] is where DocC creates JSON data for the renderer for each return sections. It's possible that we'd need [a new type of render section][spec] to display this. Maybe it's possible to unify some of the render sections. It looks to me like `ParametersRenderSection` and `PossibleValuesSection` are very similar already.

  Maybe it's possible to define a more abstract render section kind that includes the section title which could be used for all 3 (parameters, possible values, and _named_ tuple return value elements).
  /cc @mportiz08

- [`ParametersAndReturnValidator.makeReturnsSectionVariants(_:_:documentedSymbolKind:swiftSymbolKind:hasDocumentedParameters:)`][validate] is where DocC checks the documented return value and warns if there's return value documentation for a function that only returns void. This code also creates specialized return value sections for each (programming) language if the symbol has different return values in different language representations (for example `Void` in Swift but `BOOL` in Objective-C).

In each of these places it could be good to compare the return value structures and processing to the parameters processing since parameter documentation already has individual named elements.

[tag]: https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-docc/blob/main/Sources/SwiftDocC/Utility/MarkupExtensions/ListItemExtractor.swift#L113
[ret]: https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-docc/blob/main/Sources/SwiftDocC/Model/Semantics/Return.swift#L14

[render]: https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-docc/blob/main/Sources/SwiftDocC/Model/Rendering/RenderSectionTranslator/ReturnsSectionTranslator.swift
[spec]: https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-docc/blob/main/Sources/SwiftDocC/SwiftDocC.docc/Resources/RenderNode.spec.json#L2460-L2499

[validate]: https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-docc/blob/main/Sources/SwiftDocC/Model/ParametersAndReturnValidator.swift#L287-L293

Some of this code is `public` API. We don't want to break that unless it's necessary (see [Introducing source breaking changes][1] in CONTRIBUTING.md). 

It's something to be aware of but you don't need to worry too much about it up front. We can iterate together in the PR to add deprecations and compatibility wrappers to avoid any source breaking changes, if there are any.

[1]: https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-docc/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#introducing-source-breaking-changes

hey @d-ronnqvist i was trying to work on this, this is my first time trying to contribute, i was just wondering how could i test locally if my implementation works, i would appreciate any guidance you could give

How I'd go about testing this would depend on which part I'm working on. If you're asking about visually verifying the results end-to-end then I that would probably involve:
- defining a public function with a tuple return type in a new package
- writing a documentation comment for that function that documents each tuple element
- building documentation for that package to get the symbol graph output
- passing that symbol graph output to the preview command of your locally built `docc` executable
- navigating to the rendered preview page to see how the return value documentation looks on the page.

That said, if you're just getting started working on this, it will probably be easier to work on and verify a smaller piece before trying to verify the end-to-end result. 

One place to start could be in [`ReturnsSectionTranslator`](https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-docc/blob/main/Sources/SwiftDocC/Model/Rendering/RenderSectionTranslator/ReturnsSectionTranslator.swift) where you could hardcode some structure (which doesn't yet come from the documentation markup) to see if it's possible to render the name and documentation for each individual return value or if that requires [a new type or render section](https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-docc/blob/main/Sources/SwiftDocC/SwiftDocC.docc/Resources/RenderNode.spec.json#L2460-L2499). Once you know what data the `ReturnsSectionTranslator` needs to output you can write an automated test for that. For here you could either:
- gradually work your way backwards to [TaggedListItemExtractor.visitListItem(_:)](https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-docc/blob/main/Sources/SwiftDocC/Utility/MarkupExtensions/ListItemExtractor.swift#L113) where the markup for return value sections is parsed
- jump to [TaggedListItemExtractor.visitListItem(_:)](https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-docc/blob/main/Sources/SwiftDocC/Utility/MarkupExtensions/ListItemExtractor.swift#L113) (where the markup for return value sections is parsed) and gradually work your way forward until you reach the [`ReturnsSectionTranslator`](https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-docc/blob/main/Sources/SwiftDocC/Model/Rendering/RenderSectionTranslator/ReturnsSectionTranslator.swift) again.

Once you have you've connected the updated markup parsing code with the updated rendering code you'll be able to verify the happy case end-to-end. That's what some jokingly say is the first 90% done with an additional 90% remaining. 

We would want to raise warnings if the developer documented a tuple return value for a function that doesn't return a tuple or documented three tuple elements when the function only returns a tuple with two elements. DocC does this sort of validation and warnings in [`ParametersAndReturnValidator.makeReturnsSectionVariants(_:_:documentedSymbolKind:swiftSymbolKind:hasDocumentedParameters:)`](https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-docc/blob/main/Sources/SwiftDocC/Model/ParametersAndReturnValidator.swift#L287-L293).
understood, will try working through this issue, with the points you have put, thank you!

Hey @d-ronnqvist, 
Since there hasn't been recent activity, would it be okay if I start working on this? I'd really appreciate any guidance or tips you could share to get me started! 

Also @GunjanRawat26 and @thisismanan, I saw you were involved earlier. If you have any progress or updates, I'd be glad to hear them so I can decide whether to pick this up. If you're struggling with any part, maybe we could try a collaborative approach to move it forward. Any advice would also be appreciated!

Looking forward to hearing from you all. Thanks so much for your time!

issueDTO.title: RewriteTablePathUtil doesn't work with v3 deletes
issueDTO.description:
### Apache Iceberg version

1.9.2 (latest release)

### Query engine

None

### Please describe the bug 🐞

When running `TestRewriteTablePathsAction` with format-version=3 the tests fail with the below exception

```
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Content offset is required for DV
	at org.apache.iceberg.relocated.com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:141)
	at org.apache.iceberg.FileMetadata$Builder.build(FileMetadata.java:271)
	at org.apache.iceberg.RewriteTablePathUtil.writeDeleteFileEntry(RewriteTablePathUtil.java:498)
	at org.apache.iceberg.RewriteTablePathUtil.lambda$rewriteDeleteManifest$5(RewriteTablePathUtil.java:436)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:197)
	at java.base/java.util.Iterator.forEachRemaining(Iterator.java:133)
	at java.base/java.util.Spliterators$IteratorSpliterator.forEachRemaining(Spliterators.java:1845)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:509)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:499)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:921)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
	at java.base/java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.reduce(ReferencePipeline.java:657)
	at org.apache.iceberg.RewriteTablePathUtil.rewriteDeleteManifest(RewriteTablePathUtil.java:444)
	at org.apache.iceberg.spark.actions.RewriteTablePathSparkAction.writeDeleteManifest(RewriteTablePathSparkAction.java:606)
	at org.apache.iceberg.spark.actions.RewriteTablePathSparkAction.lambda$toManifests$f0b4715c$1(RewriteTablePathSparkAction.java:547)
```

This is because https://github.com/apache/iceberg/blob/main/core/src/main/java/org/apache/iceberg/RewriteTablePathUtil.java#L493-L498 doesn't carry over DVs properly.

We need to carry over `contentOffset` / `contentSizeInBytes` / `referencedDataFile` (most likely in the `copy()` method). Also we need to update `TestRewriteTablePathsAction` to work with format versions 2 and above

### Willingness to contribute

- [ ] I can contribute a fix for this bug independently
- [ ] I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the Iceberg community
- [ ] I cannot contribute a fix for this bug at this time

I'm a beginner, but I'll do my best!
@capDoYeonLee yes go for it. Nobody expressed interest in working on this so far, so just feel free to open a PR and we'll go from there

Also FYI @singhpk234 https://github.com/apache/iceberg/pull/7011/files#r2230609759

Hello, @nastra 
I added the missing fields to the internal copy() method of FileMetadata.
```
this.referencedDataFile = toCopy.referencedDataFile();
this.contentOffset = toCopy.contentOffset();
this.contentSizeInBytes = toCopy.contentSizeInBytes();
```
After adding them, errors such as ```java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Content offset is required for DV``` no longer occur.

However, after adding the missing fields, when testing with format-version=3, ```an Unsupported file format: PUFFIN``` exception occurs.
```
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: Unsupported file format: PUFFIN
            at org.apache.iceberg.spark.actions.RewriteTablePathSparkAction.positionDeletesReader(RewriteTablePathSparkAction.java:705)
            at org.apache.iceberg.spark.actions.RewriteTablePathSparkAction$SparkPositionDeleteReaderWriter.reader(RewriteTablePathSparkAction.java:642)

            at org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset.$anonfun$foreach$2(Dataset.scala:3507)

            at scala.collection.Iterator.foreach(Iterator.scala:943)
            at scala.collection.Iterator.foreach$(Iterator.scala:943)
            at scala.collection.AbstractIterator.foreach(Iterator.scala:1431)
            at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD.$anonfun$foreach$2(RDD.scala:1031)
            at org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD.$anonfun$foreach$2$adapted(RDD.scala:1031)
            at org.apache.spark.SparkContext.$anonfun$runJob$5(SparkContext.scala:2433)
            at org.apache.spark.scheduler.ResultTask.runTask(ResultTask.scala:93)
            at org.apache.spark.TaskContext.runTaskWithListeners(TaskContext.scala:166)
            at org.apache.spark.scheduler.Task.run(Task.scala:141)
            at org.apache.spark.executor.Executor$TaskRunner.$anonfun$run$4(Executor.scala:621)
            at org.apache.spark.util.SparkErrorUtils.tryWithSafeFinally(SparkErrorUtils.scala:64)
            at org.apache.spark.util.SparkErrorUtils.tryWithSafeFinally$(SparkErrorUtils.scala:61)
            at org.apache.spark.util.Utils$.tryWithSafeFinally(Utils.scala:94)
            at org.apache.spark.executor.Executor$TaskRunner.run(Executor.scala:624)
            at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1136)
            at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:635)
            at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:840)
```

Currently, ```an Unsupported file format: PUFFIN``` exception occurs. 
I am having trouble with this error. Could you please advise me on how to resolve it?
thank you!

issueDTO.title: NetworkPolicy tests for blocking north/south traffic
issueDTO.description:
The NP docs point out that [NP's semantics for north/south traffic are not very clearly defined](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/network-policies/#behavior-of-ipblock-selectors):

> Cluster ingress and egress mechanisms often require rewriting the source or destination IP of packets. In cases where this happens, it is not defined whether this happens before or after NetworkPolicy processing, and the behavior may be different for different combinations of network plugin, cloud provider, `Service` implementation, etc.
> 
> In the case of ingress, this means that in some cases you may be able to filter incoming packets based on the actual original source IP, while in other cases, the "source IP" that the NetworkPolicy acts on may be the IP of a `LoadBalancer` or of the Pod's node, etc.
> 
> For egress, this means that connections from pods to `Service` IPs that get rewritten to cluster-external IPs may or may not be subject to `ipBlock`-based policies.

However, what's _not_ ambiguous is that a pod which is fully isolated for ingress should not accept E/W _or_ N/S traffic. Regardless of how the ingress/LB/cloud handles the traffic, it should end up getting blocked. (Well, unless it gets masqueraded to the pod's node IP, because then it hits that exception to the rules.)

Unfortunately we can't say the same for egress; I think we assume that a pod-to-service-IP connection will be allowed to reach kube-proxy even if the pod is fully isolated-for-egress, but we explicitly don't require that `ipBlock` policies get applied after service proxying.

Anyway, we should be able to add a test to `test/e2e/network/netpol/network_policy.go` that confirms that cluster-ingress traffic to a fully isolated-for-ingress pod is not allowed. In particular, if we create a LoadBalancer Service with `externalTrafficPolicy: Local`, and a NetworkPolicy blocking all ingress to that Service's Pods, then we should not be able to connect to the service via either the LoadBalancer IP/name or via its NodePort (on one of the correct nodes).

/sig network
/area network-policy
/priority backlog
/help
/good-first-issue
comments:
@danwinship: 
	This request has been marked as suitable for new contributors.

### Guidelines
Please ensure that the issue body includes answers to the following questions:
- Why are we solving this issue?
- To address this issue, are there any code changes? If there are code changes, what needs to be done in the code and what places can the assignee treat as reference points?
- Does this issue have zero to low barrier of entry?
- How can the assignee reach out to you for help?


For more details on the requirements of such an issue, please see [here](https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/help-wanted.md#good-first-issue) and ensure that they are met.

If this request no longer meets these requirements, the label can be removed
by commenting with the `/remove-good-first-issue` command.


<details>

In response to [this](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/114369):

>The NP docs point out that [NP's semantics for north/south traffic are not very clearly defined](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/network-policies/#behavior-of-ipblock-selectors):
>
>> Cluster ingress and egress mechanisms often require rewriting the source or destination IP of packets. In cases where this happens, it is not defined whether this happens before or after NetworkPolicy processing, and the behavior may be different for different combinations of network plugin, cloud provider, `Service` implementation, etc.
>> 
>> In the case of ingress, this means that in some cases you may be able to filter incoming packets based on the actual original source IP, while in other cases, the "source IP" that the NetworkPolicy acts on may be the IP of a `LoadBalancer` or of the Pod's node, etc.
>> 
>> For egress, this means that connections from pods to `Service` IPs that get rewritten to cluster-external IPs may or may not be subject to `ipBlock`-based policies.
>
>However, what's _not_ ambiguous is that a pod which is fully isolated for ingress should not accept E/W _or_ N/S traffic. Regardless of how the ingress/LB/cloud handles the traffic, it should end up getting blocked. (Well, unless it gets masqueraded to the pod's node IP, because then it hits that exception to the rules.)
>
>Unfortunately we can't say the same for egress; I think we assume that a pod-to-service-IP connection will be allowed to reach kube-proxy even if the pod is fully isolated-for-egress, but we explicitly don't require that `ipBlock` policies get applied after service proxying.
>
>Anyway, we should be able to add a test to `test/e2e/network/netpol/network_policy.go` that confirms that cluster-ingress traffic to a fully isolated-for-ingress pod is not allowed. In particular, if we create a LoadBalancer Service with `externalTrafficPolicy: Local`, and a NetworkPolicy blocking all ingress to that Service's Pods, then we should not be able to connect to the service via either the LoadBalancer IP/name or via its NodePort (on one of the correct nodes).
>
>/sig network
>/area network-policy
>/priority backlog
>/help
>/good-first-issue

Interested in taking this on. Below is my understanding and proposed approach???please let me know if I???ve missed anything or made any incorrect assumptions. Thanks!

1. **Issue interpretation:** A pod which is fully isolated for ingress must never receive any north/south traffic, even when fronted by a LoadBalancer or NodePort, unless that traffic is SNAT'd to the node IP (which, based on the discussion above, appears to be an expected and accepted exception). Becasue SNAT can occur before or after NetworkPolicy evaluation, the policy may be non-deterministically bypassed depending on the network plugin, cloud provider, or service implementation.
 
2. **Goal interpretation:** Add a deterministic E2E test that verifies a fully isolated ingress policy blocks all traffic.

3. **Proposed approach:** A test in `/kubernetes/test/e2e/network/loadbalancer.go` that:
	1. Deploys a simple HTTP echo-server Pod.
	2. Apply a NetworkPolicy with no ingress rules.
	3. Create a Service of  type `LoadBalancer` with `externalTrafficPolicy: Local` (to preserve client IP and avoid kube-proxy SNAT/cross-node proxying)
	4. From e2e host, attempt to  curl the LoadBalancer IP (and the NodePort on that node).
		- Pass if connection times out/refuses
		- Fail if it succeeds

4. **Questions / Considerations:**
	- **Test Location**: Should this live under `/kubernetes/test/e2e/network/netpol/network_policy.go` (to keep all NP tests together), or is `network/loadbalancer.go` more appropriate given the LB focus and fact that the current tests in `netpol/network_policy.go` test pod -> pod, while this test requires external -> pod via LB/NodePort.
	- **NodePort coverage:** Is an additional test needed for pod ??? Service(NodePort) traffic, since this can also involve SNAT and might expose similar bypass behavior?
	- **Underlying non-determinism:** Even with `externalTrafficPolicy: Local` or host-based testing, the root cause, SNAT ordering vs. policy enforcement, remains unpredictable. Can/does this underlying issue need to be addressed?

> * **Test Location**

Probably `tests/e2e/network/netpol/network_policy.go` should be moved up a level to `test/e2e/network/network_policy.go` (based on the comments in that file, it seems like maybe that was the original plan?), and `netpol/` should only contain the helpers, not the actual e2e tests themselves. And then the new test can be added to `test/e2e/network/network_policy.go`?

Note that wherever it ends up, the test will need both `feature.NetworkPolicy` and `feature.LoadBalancer`.

> * **NodePort coverage**

The non-`externalTrafficPolicy: Local` case is expected to do SNAT and the `externalTrafficPolicy: Local` case for NodePort is not interestingly different from the LoadBalancer IP case, so there's probably no point in testing this separately.

> * **Underlying non-determinism**

It's not really "non-determinism"; any given environment is deterministic. And some people will run the e2e suite in environments that will fail the test due to SNAT. So I think the result should be:
- connection is blocked: **Pass**
- connection is accepted with original source IP preserved: **Fail**
- connection is accepted with source IP changed: **Skip**

I think having the test skip itself when it detects SNAT is preferable to just telling people "you should skip this test if your environment doesn't support it", because you're only supposed to skip it if the connection gets through because your load balancer did the "wrong" thing, _not_ if the connection gets through because your _network plugin_ does the wrong thing.
/assign
Hey @Yash-xoxo, I've still been working on this and plan to push a PR this week!

@danwinship, sorry for the slow progress on this one.  I wrote the new e2e test and moved the netpol tests one level up as you suggested in your above comment. 

To validate the  "connection is accepted with source IP changed: Skip" path however, I've spend quite a while (attempting) to reproduce, on KIND, the the scenario where SNAT lets traffic bypass the default-deny network policy (Using eTP: Cluster, as I'll touch on below).

As I was having difficultly I took a step back, and started to wonder if this branch is even needed for the following reasons:

- With eTP = Local, client IP preservation is mandatory (mentioned [here](https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/pull/4632#discussion_r1603346835)), so any SNAT would already violate the eTP = Local contract.
- The test, as I implemented it, is "should enforce default-deny ingress policy against LoadBalancer traffic with ExternalTrafficPolicy: Local". Based on this if the connection is accepted, then either:
  1. The NetPol was bypasssed
  2. eTP = Local didnt preserve the client IP (SNAT)

In both scenarios I would think the test should simply fail, rather than requiring special "SNAT detection" logic. I was wondering however if this matches what you had in mind or if I am misunderstanding something/ overlooking an edge case.

issueDTO.title: Weather Plugin - Visability Issue - Not Respecting Saved Units of Measure
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
Open Weather is still showing KM instead of Miles

**Expected behavior**
It should change between KM and MI depending on the saved units of measure.
comments: This is an issue with the OpenWeatherMap API, looks like they always provide the visibility measurement in km regardless of the units parameter. However we could do the conversion in the weather plugin based on the units selected.

Refactor app-additional.html to move <script> block into external JavaScript file

# Description:

The `app-additional.html` template currently contains a `<script> `block at the bottom of the file with logic. To improve code organization and follow separation of concerns, we should extract this script into a standalone JavaScript file under `static/js/`.

 - [ ] Keep the code behavior identical???no UX changes

# Out of Scope:

- [ ] Refactoring JavaScript from other templates (handle those in separate issues)
- [ ] Changing styles or interactions
- [ ] Replacing or removing functionality

issueDTO.title: Time Series Support
issueDTO.description:
This issue is designed to track progress towards full time series support in TorchGeo. If you are interested in helping with this effort, please join the `#time-series` channel on [Slack](https://join.slack.com/t/torchgeo/shared_invite/zt-22rse667m-eqtCeNW0yI000Tl4B~2PIw) and attend our weekly meetings.

### Datasets

#### Required changes

- [x] Replace R-tree with geopandas: #2747
- [x] Spatial-only intersection: #2837
- [ ] Convert change detection datasets: #2862, #2863, #2878, #2879
- [ ] Convert time series datasets
- [ ] Return time series: #2308 
- [ ] Xarray support: #1490
- [ ] ERA5
- [ ] CMIP6
- [ ] WeatherBench
- [ ] Air pollution: #2639
- [ ] EPA: @adamjstewart 
- [ ] Splitters: guarantee non-overlapping spatial and/or temporal splits
- [ ] Collation functions for padding

#### Desired changes

- [x] Replace BoundingBox with slicing: #2804
- [x] Support Polygon ROIs in all splitters: #2835
- [x] Deprecate BoundingBox: #2847
- [ ] Store true image footprint: #1881
- [ ] Properly handle vector datasets, drop fiona dependency: @isaaccorley
- [ ] Cache geopandas index: @isaaccorley
- [ ] Support integer indexing?: @adamjstewart
- [ ] Unify GeoDataset and NonGeoDataset?: #1353
- [ ] Intersection/Union multiple queries?: #2408
- [ ] Tuple/MultiQuery dataset?: #877

### Samplers

- [x] Support Polygon ROIs in all samplers: #2812
- [ ] Reimplement existing samplers
- [ ] Add new time series samplers: #877
- [ ] Window sampler
- [ ] Change detection sampler
- [ ] Ensure samplers do not sample outside Polygon bounds
- [ ] Support weighted samplers: #757

### Transforms

- [ ] B x T x C x H x W <-> B x TC x H x W: #2477 (TODO: image + mask)
- [ ] Temporal embeddings: #2826
- [ ] Temporal up/downsampling: @yichiac 
- [ ] UTC time <-> local time: @yichiac 
- [ ] Data imputation: @yichiac 

### Models

#### 1D

- [x] RNNs: LSTMs, GRUs
- [ ] Seq2Seq: #2639 
- [x] L-TAE: #2867
- [ ] TempCNN: https://github.com/charlotte-pel/temporalCNN
- [ ] Chronos: @cnagda?
- [ ] Galileo
- [ ] Presto: @cnagda?

#### 2.5D

- [x] ChangeStar
- [x] FarSeg
- [x] FC-Siam
- [ ] ChangeViT: @hkristen

#### 3D

- [x] Satlas
- [ ] Conv-LSTM: #2898
- [ ] CNN-LSTM
- [ ] AnySat
- [ ] OmniSat
- [ ] Prithvi v1, v2: @isaaccorley 
- [ ] SatMAE: @isaaccorley 
- [ ] SkySense v1, v2

#### 4D

- [ ] Aurora: #2823
- [ ] NeuralGCM: #2850
- [ ] Climate: @cnagda?

### Trainers

- [x] Change detection: #2422, #2890
- [ ] Autoregression: #2639
- [ ] Modify existing trainers: @keves1

### Documentation

- [ ] Crop type mapping tutorial: #2449 
- [ ] Change detection tutorial: @hkristen
- [ ] Air pollution tutorial
- [ ] Weather forecasting tutorial: @cnagda
- [ ] Climate modeling tutorial?: @cnagda

### Outdated discussions

- #640
- #1544

issueDTO.title: Refactor app-form.html to remove inline styles and move CSS to SCSS file
issueDTO.description:
🚨 **_Ensure your PR is merging into the [`mvp` branch](https://github.com/Techtonica/techtonica.org/blob/mvp/) where you will find this work._**

Refactor app-form.html to remove inline styles and move CSS to SCSS file

# Description:

The `app-form.html` template currently contains a large `<style>` block with form styling directly in the HTML file. To improve maintainability and keep styles organized, we should move these styles into the appropriate `.scss` file and remove the inline style block from the HTML.

This is a fast follow from this [PR](https://github.com/Techtonica/techtonica.org/pull/615#pullrequestreview-2711350658)

# Tasks:

- [ ] Move all `<style> `block content from `templates/app-form.html` into the SCSS file
- [ ] Remove the entire `<style>` block from the HTML file once verified
- [ ] Extract shared styles across application forms into reusable mixins or partials
- [ ] Test to make sure no styles have changed
- [ ] Move form styles to a new partial `_form.scss` file

Be sure to follow the [CSS SCSS Styling Instructions Wiki](https://github.com/Techtonica/techtonica.org/wiki/CSS-SCSS-Styling-Instructions-Wiki) to adequately make these changes.

# Out of Scope:
- Refactoring javascript to its own file
- Refactoring styles of other forms
- Style changes or updates - all styles should be visually unchanged

issueDTO.title: Add tests for <MultiSearch> component
issueDTO.description:
Write unit tests for the `<MultiSearch>` React component to ensure expected behavior, edge case handling, and rendering logic.

## Essential Test Coverage Checklist

- [ ] **Renders successfully with minimal required props**  
- [ ] **Conditional rendering logic**  
- [ ] **Prop-based behavior** ??? different props affect output  
- [ ] **Event handling** ??? simulate user actions and verify callbacks  
- [ ] **State changes / internal logic**  
- [ ] **Default values and fallbacks**  
- [ ] **Text and content rendering**  
- [ ] **Handles edge cases and invalid inputs**  
- [ ] **Accessibility roles and labels**  
- [ ] **DOM structure / classNames / styles**


## Test Reference  
You can refer to the `AutoScrollToTop.test.tsx` file for an example of structure and best practices.  
To explore more examples, see the full component tests folder.

issueDTO.title: Sketcher: Unchecking `Show only filtered Constraints` does not show constraints in the 3D view
issueDTO.description:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Forums discussion

https://forum.freecad.org/viewtopic.php?t=77723

### Version

0.21 (Development)  
1.1.0dev.41837

### Full version info

```shell
OS: Windows 8.1 Version 6.3 (Build 9600)
Word size of FreeCAD: 64-bit
Version: 0.21.0.32867 (Git)
Build type: Release
Branch: master
Hash: 89ebbfebcd2574aa59c72795add4c9aa793a4212
Python 3.10.10, Qt 5.15.8, Coin 4.0.0, Vtk 9.1.0, OCC 7.6.3
Locale: Dutch/Netherlands (nl_NL)
Installed mods:
```


### Subproject(s) affected?

Sketcher

### Issue description

1. Create a sketch with a line and a single dimensional (distance) constraint.
2. In the Constraints section of the task panel uncheck "Datums" in the Filter list.
3. Result: the constraint is longer displayed in the list but still visible in the 3D view (OK).
4. Click on the down arrow next to the rightmost button in the section and check "Show only filtered Constraints".
5. Result: the constraint is hidden in the 3D view (OK).
6. Uncheck the filter checkbox. Notice that the checkbox before the constraint in the list is still checked. Check the filter checkbox again.
7. Uncheck "Show only filtered Constraints".
8. Result: The constraint in not made visible in the 3D view (Bug?)
9. Uncheck the filter checkbox. Notice that the checkbox before the constraint in the list is now unchecked. 

### Anything else?

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
comments:

If the issue is still relevant, let us know by adding a comment.
Otherwise, we???ll close this issue automatically in 60 days.

Feel free to comment anytime to keep it open. Closed issues can always be reopened.

issueDTO.title: [Docs]: Improve vercel.json Configuration with Production URL
issueDTO.description:
### 📝 What needs improvement?

We need to improve the vercel.json configuration file to properly integrate our production backend URL for API rewrites or redirects. This will ensure the frontend deployed on Vercel proxies or redirects requests correctly to the production server, maintaining smooth operation in production.

Tasks:

Update vercel.json to include rewrites for API routes to point to the production URL.

Optionally, add redirects from any legacy or old paths to new ones using the production URL.

Ensure the configuration supports environment differentiation if needed, using hardcoded URL or environment variables.

Test the deployment on Vercel in production mode to verify requests correctly route to production backend.

Document changes, including usage of environment variables if introduced for URLs.

### 💡 Suggested Fix

_No response_

### 📎 Additional Information

_No response_

### ??? Duplicate Check

- [x] I have searched existing issues and documentation to ensure this hasn't already been addressed.

These are my teammates: @JZavala210 @krishneetRAJ My teammates and I are currently working on this issue. We???re currently investigating an issue where creating a new .product file, selecting the `org.eclipse.equinox.p2.director` application, and launching it results in an error: Application "org.eclipse.equinox.p2.director" could not be found in the registry. So, this is the workflow we observed: - We created a new product configuration. - In the ???features??? tab, we noticed eclipse.sdk was not available to select. - We did not manually add Eclipse SDK to the target platform. - We proceeded to the ???launch configuration??? and selected org.eclipse.equinox.p2.director as the application. - Launch fails with the above error. Our assumption is that the missing SDK and/or dependencies are why the selected application cannot be found in the registry. To investigate deeper, we added debug changes in the `getApplicationNameSet()` method, which controls the dropdown list of available applications in the .product file UI. That function pulls all application extensions using `findExtensions("org.eclipse.core.runtime.applications", true)`. Looking into `findExtensions()`, we noticed that it does not currently check whether the extension is available based on the product's dependencies. Can you please help us check our understanding? Does our understanding of how the `.product` file and application registration work seem correct? If not, are we missing a step in setting up the right dependencies? We would appreciate any feedback. Thank you very much!

Hello, My teammates @vihuynh72 and @JZavala210 have continued to work on the issue related to filtering the list of available applications in the Eclipse PDE runtime configuration. Currently, we were looking at the `getApplicationNameSet()` method. As mentioned by my teammate @vihuynh72, `getApplicationNameSet()` controls the dropdown list of available applications in the .product editor UI. This method ultimately calls `PDECore.getDefault().getExtensionsRegistry().findExtensions("org.eclipse.core.runtime.applications", true)`. As you can see from this screenshot, we've confirmed this displays many applications. What we've tried so far: - We've reviewed the implementation of `findExtensions` in `PDEExtensionRegistry.java` and noticed that when `activeOnly` is set to true, it filters using `PluginRegistry.getActiveModels()`. - We've also tried modifying the logic in the `else` block of `findExtensions` to change how extensions are gathered, but this had no impact on what was shown in the application dropdown list in the .product UI, which led us to wonder whether the filtering of applications needs to happen earlier or somewhere else. Our current hypothesis is that the list of applications should be filtered down to only include those contributed by plugins that the current project explicitly needs, and therefore, we may need to update the UI logic to filter these based on what plugins are currently selected or included. Could you please confirm if our understanding is correct? Should the application dropdown ideally be filtered based on the current plugin???s dependencies? And if so, is there a separate step or location in the codebase where this filtering is intended to happen? Any insight/clarification would be very helpful! Thank you very much.

> Our assumption is that the missing SDK and/or dependencies are why the selected application cannot be found in the registry.
> 
> To investigate deeper, we added debug changes in the `getApplicationNameSet()` method, which controls the dropdown list of available applications in the .product file UI. That function pulls all application extensions using `findExtensions("org.eclipse.core.runtime.applications", true)`. Looking into `findExtensions()`, we noticed that it does not currently check whether the extension is available based on the product's dependencies.
> 
> Can you please help us check our understanding? Does our understanding of how the .product file and application registration work seem correct?

Yes that's absolutely correct and the root cause of the problem.

> Our current hypothesis is that the list of applications should be filtered down to only include those contributed by plugins that the current project explicitly needs, and therefore, we may need to update the UI logic to filter these based on what plugins are currently selected or included.

Yes the list should be filtered to only include the applications provided by plugins included into the launch. You can obtain the provider's name easily using:
`String name = elements[0].getContributor().getName();`

So the only missing part is to obtain the list of bundles/plugins included into a product and then that list/set should be passed to the `getApplicationNameSet()` (probably only the internal method). But for the former no trivial solution exists yet.
Nevertheless the building blocks exists, but have to be assembled.

The computation of all Plugins included in a launch can be done using (using `osgi=false`):
https://github.com/eclipse-pde/eclipse.pde/blob/260640d9827f44452bd0e03d1baea7efe3ab191b/ui/org.eclipse.pde.launching/src/org/eclipse/pde/internal/launching/launcher/BundleLauncherHelper.java#L110

Unfortunately this methods requires a launch configuration as input, so I suggest to create a temporary (hidden) one on the fly to call that method with. To do that you can create a new `org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.LaunchAction` for the current product and call `findLaunchConfiguration()`. Maybe we should introduce a new method that always creates a new config and never saves it to prevent it from becoming visible in the UI.

> The computation of all Plugins included in a launch can be done using (using `osgi=false`):
> 
> [eclipse.pde/ui/org.eclipse.pde.launching/src/org/eclipse/pde/internal/launching/launcher/BundleLauncherHelper.java](https://github.com/eclipse-pde/eclipse.pde/blob/260640d9827f44452bd0e03d1baea7efe3ab191b/ui/org.eclipse.pde.launching/src/org/eclipse/pde/internal/launching/launcher/BundleLauncherHelper.java#L110)
> 
> Unfortunately this methods requires a launch configuration as input, so I suggest to create a temporary (hidden) one on the fly to call that method with. To do that you can create a new `org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.launcher.LaunchAction` for the current product and call `findLaunchConfiguration()`. Maybe we should introduce a new method that always creates a new config and never saves it to prevent it from becoming visible in the UI.

Disregard this part. There is already a method for exactly that purpose:
https://github.com/eclipse-pde/eclipse.pde/blob/260640d9827f44452bd0e03d1baea7efe3ab191b/ui/org.eclipse.pde.ui/src/org/eclipse/pde/internal/ui/launcher/LaunchAction.java#L98-L104

From the returned set you can get the symbolic-names from all bundles in the launch (and if you want to be very exact, also their IDs).

issueDTO.title: Give list mods ability to overwrite GD level_id after adding demons
issueDTO.description:
Currently, when adding new demons, the frontend makes specifying the GD level id of the level mandatory (the backend has no such stipulations though). However, after the demon is added, it cannot be changed again via the API (PATCH /demons/ doesn't even support a `level_id` field). We should fix that up:

- [x] Make level id optional when adding demons on the frontend as well (was done in #203)
- [ ] Allow PATCH /demons/ to change level_ids
- [ ] Give frontend interface for changing level IDs

issueDTO.title: Make happy path tests use the default configs
issueDTO.description: Currently, the happy path tests manually define a config. It would be better if they used the default config for that experiment, and just adjusted  what was needed (C, steps, etc.). This is because we want to know when something breaks with the default config. issueDTO.title: HierarchyColumn Tag Parameter Is Ignored
issueDTO.description:
### Bug type

Component

### Component name

HierarchyColumn

### What happened?

The HeirarchyColumn has a `Tag` parameter but this value is ignored and instead hard coded to be `"hierarchy-column"`.

This leads to confusing behavior when attempting to programmatically filter for the column.

In the context of my project, I am manually hiding / showing columns independent of the controls and would like to filter out this column from being hidden.

https://github.com/MudBlazor/MudBlazor/blob/dev/src/MudBlazor/Components/DataGrid/HierarchyColumn.razor#L5

### Expected behavior

I expect parameter values I assign to be respected. I expect to be able to programmatically identify the hierarchy column more easily.

### Reproduction link

https://try.mudblazor.com/snippet/caQyEhvirGLvuhxl

### Reproduction steps

See code snippet.

1. Expand the table row for any item.
2. Note that "test-value" is not present 

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Version (bug)

7.3.0

### Version (working)

_No response_

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Firefox

### On which operating systems are you experiencing the issue?

macOS

### Pull Request

- [ ] I would like to do a Pull Request

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
comments:
Currently, `Tag` is used for special columns like `HierarchyColumn` and `SelectColumn` to distinguish them, as they have special positioning, etc.
Pull requests to change this are welcome.

issueDTO.title: Separate transportation and intersection info in the Mobility category
issueDTO.description: Separate transportation and intersection items in the Mobility category under Manage Callouts' in the main Settings menu
comments: That switch actually controls three callout groups: intersections, transportation, and safety (e.g. steps and other hazards). Do we want to group safety with intersections or with transportation? Arguably the intersections are a type of safety callout, but perhaps the point of separating the intersection callout toggle is to allow everything except intersections to continue being called out.

That's a great point :-) Perhaps we split out all 3 separately? All the other Callout options are quite binary whereas this one currently incorporates 3 different types...so splitting them out will allow a person to fine-tune the information they wish to hear. It will increase the panel and require more scrolling for the page...but I think it's worth doing.

I could also argue that the safety spots callout should remain on unless the user decides to turn all callouts off. In the early days of Microsoft Soundscape, there used to be a toggle switch for the Location Updates callout, but starting around the early 2020's,the Location Updates callout became permanently turned on and cannot directly be configured by the user. My argument to leave safety spots on is so that the user is always aware of anything hazardous while walking around. That way the "Manage Callouts" menu wouldn't be cluttered with too many configurations. If we decide to go ahead with my solution, I also wrote a revision to the help documentation explaining "Note: some callouts essential for safe navigation do not have their own toggle switch and can only be disabled with the "Allow Callouts" button." Anyway, having all three callouts in this section or just Transportation and Intersections will be an improvement, even for sighted users. The term Mobility isn't as intuitive for the average user.
I can look into this
Do we know which files in the backend are connected to the different toggles that we want from the Mobility section?

The code where the single toggle is changing three separate settings is here: https://github.com/soundscape-community/soundscape/blob/6a84924d63fc0a2542abac51d8c823832f0330d7/apps/ios/GuideDogs/Code/Visual%20UI/Controls/Settings/CalloutSettingsCellView.swift#L84-L90

The visual design for the toggle is in a storyboard: https://github.com/soundscape-community/soundscape/blob/6a84924d63fc0a2542abac51d8c823832f0330d7/apps/ios/GuideDogs/Code/Visual%20UI/Views/Settings.storyboard#L270-L317

That's all you should really need to tweak for this feature. You don't need to dive into how those settings are used by the `AutoCalloutGenerator` to filter the announcements.

Just for clarification, I separated Transportation and Intersection into 2 different toggles. Before I make a pull request I want to confirm that we get rid of the Mobility toggle altogether and it just be the 2 new toggles?

Based on your description, it looks like you are using my suggestion of leaving the safety callouts on permanently without a toggle switch. It might be a good idea to look at the advantages and drawbacks of the two suggestions. Would we rather have fewer toggle switches or a more customizable UI? My own suggestion has the safety callouts to not have a toggle switch so that the user is always aware of them in order to stay safe while walking. This may be good with cane or guide dog travel or for those individuals who are less experienced with O&M because a mobility device alone may not catch some safety spots. This solution also produces a less cluttered UI. You could argue in favor of the previous suggestion from Jchudge that having a toggle for safety callouts so the user turns off everything except for intersections may produce a more streamlined listening experience. That solution could be great for very experienced cane travelers who don't need that much guidance from Soundscape's callouts. The drawback is that the list of toggle switches looks a bit too long and overwhelming for beginners. Should we take a vote or something? Thanks.

Mmm, I don't think we should make safety callouts permanently on.  There's a valid use case for the app  for low-vision non-cane users who don't need assistance finding steps and crosswalks but just want to hear road and shop signs they can't read.

I'd suggest making three toggles, for mobility, transportation, and intersections. This shouldn't be much more difficult than two toggles, since the setting is already split into three under the hood.

Thanks, since I don't object to having three separate toggle switches, should the new buttons be labeled "Transportation," "Intersections," and "Safety?" What should we do with the old "Mobility" switch? I assume that the "Mobility" or "Safety" button would be redundant if both buttons are in the UI so I think we can try either of two solutions. If we keep the "Mobility" label, and use the safety callouts for that label, then we should create an accessibility hint like "Info for safe navigation." If you would rather go with "Safety" as the new callout name, the hint for the button could be written as "Info for safe mobility." I can't come up with a good hint description right now, but you should get the gist. After everything is put together, the final list should be ""Allow Callouts," Places & Landmarks," "Mobility" or "Safety," "Transportation," "Intersections," "Distance to the Audio Beacon" and "Repeat Callouts." Maybe the order of callouts can be switched around a bit. Since the old "Mobility" hint said "Intersection and Transportation Info," it may be better to put the "Transportation" button after the "Intersection" button for consistency.

Ah, good point, the three categories should actually be Mobility, Safety, and Intersections. The "Mobility" category encompasses some random stuff that aren't directly related to modes of transportation, like ATMs and NaviLens codes.

Here's a stab at the new hint text:
* Mobility: Practical features like crosswalks and bus stops.
* Safety: Potential hazards like steps and construction areas
* Intersections: Announce street names and their directions

So how I'm understanding what the final list should look like is this: "Allow Callouts," "Places & Landmarks," "Mobility," "Safety," "Intersections," "Distance to Audio Beacon," and "Repeat Callouts." BTW, thanks for the new accessibility hints.

> So how I'm understanding what the final list should look like is this: "Allow Callouts," "Places & Landmarks," "Mobility," "Safety," "Intersections," "Distance to Audio Beacon," and "Repeat Callouts."

Yep, that sounds right to me.

This message is for MBtheOtaku. I saw some of the changes in your "Log Of Changes" pull request, but it's better if you open a PR just for this issue. When you open up a new PR, be sure to put in the localized text for the new callouts and hints into the strings. That way, when it gets merged, I can be able to translate everything to Spanish on Weblate. BTW, I already have the text of Steinbro's hints in Spanish in my notes so I can just copy and paste. Thanks.
Yeah I'm not sure why the commits for the new issue are going to an old pull request I made a long time ago but I will try to separate it out and make a new one

issueDTO.title: Add dim order variant clone operator
issueDTO.description:
Currently clone operator is removed in the export pipeline without tracing its (possible) memory format / dim order changes within the copy and may lead to wrong memory format / dim order changes in the final exported model.

One of the essential features to solve the issue is creating dim order variant clone operator to ensure the correct dim order propagation in export graph. With the dim order variant clone op, we can make the `TestRemoveCloneOpsTransform` remove clone operator with dim order aware of.

cc. @digantdesai 

### Alternatives

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### RFC (Optional)

_No response_

cc @JacobSzwejbka @angelayi
comments:
so,
(1) create `clone_dim_order` op
(2) update the `MemoryFormatOps` pass to replace clone with this op
(3) update `TestRemoveCloneOpsTransform` pass to be dim_order aware (not memory_format)

I'd like to work on this! I have a few questions:

1. After registering `clone_dim_order` in `dim_order_ops_registery.py`, will `MemoryFormatOpsPass` automatically replace `aten.clone` with `clone_dim_order`, or are additional changes required to ensure that the mapping occurs?

2. Once `_clone_dim_order.out` is declared in `edge_dialect_aten_op.yaml`, where should the corresponding kernel implementation be placed?

3. If `clone_dim_order` changes the dim order of its input, is it treated as a permanent op, or does its removal from the graph before final export need to be implemented in a pass?

4. I wasn???t able to find `TestRemoveCloneOpsTransform` in the codebase. Is this referring to a test that should be added in `test_memory_format_ops_pass.py` to validate the removal of `clone_dim_order`?

@keyprocedure Thanks for taking this!

1. In the AOT side, yes, the replacement will be happen. We still need to impl runtime operators.
2. for its aten version, please put it here https://github.com/pytorch/executorch/tree/main/kernels/aten/cpu; for its portable version, please here https://github.com/pytorch/executorch/tree/main/kernels/portable/cpu
3. if it will change dim order, it should not be removed for dim order correctness.

issueDTO.title: Ai detection in resume building
issueDTO.description:
Hello, my name is Raj Basnet, and I am a participant in the GirlScript Summer of Code.

I have observed that many recruiters use AI-detection tools to filter resumes, and documents generated directly using GPT often get flagged as AI-written. This prevents recruiters from even reviewing those resumes.

To address this, I propose building a solution where GPT generates LaTeX code for any chosen resume template. The LaTeX code can then be compiled into a professional resume. Since the final output is a compiled LaTeX PDF, it will not be flagged as AI-generated, ensuring that candidates??? resumes reach recruiters without bias.

I plan to create an API endpoint for this resume-building service, making it accessible and easy to integrate. I am excited to contribute this project as part of the GirlScript Summer of Code and believe it will significantly benefit job seekers.

I show the issue in the project so I myself want to work on that issue so I raise the issue even I want to work on this issue

If your PR modifies or deletes any core code without purpose, it will not be merged.

📽??? Always try to attach a short screen recording or screenshots of your work to validate your implementation.

Thanks @rajbasnet123789 for this thoughtful and highly relevant feature proposal! You're absolutely right ??? with many recruiters using AI-detection tools, even qualified candidates risk being filtered out when submitting AI-generated resumes. Your idea to **generate LaTeX-based resumes via GPT and serve them as compiled PDFs** is both clever and impactful.

### 💡 Feature Summary:

🔧 **Goal**: Allow users to input their details, and generate a **LaTeX resume template** using GPT ??? which is compiled into a **PDF**, making it **undetectable as AI-written**.

### 🧱 Technical Approach:

* **Frontend**:

  * A form where users enter name, education, experience, skills, etc.
  * Option to select a LaTeX resume template

* **Backend (API)**:

  * Accepts user details
  * GPT or logic generates LaTeX code based on a selected template
  * Compile LaTeX to PDF using tools like `pdflatex`, `latexmk`, or `tectonic`
  * Return the final downloadable PDF

* **Tech Stack Suggestion**:

  * `Node.js` with Express (or your backend stack)
  * Use `child_process` to run LaTeX compiler in backend
  * Optional: GPT API if you want dynamic LaTeX generation
  * Store templates in `/templates` folder

### ??? Assignment:

Assigning this issue to @rajbasnet123789 under **GSSOC???25**. Feel free to:

* Break the implementation into smaller tasks (template design, form, backend compile logic)
* Use dummy data first, then connect frontend ??? backend

issueDTO.title: Sync shouldHaveRole in db
issueDTO.description:
## Description 📹

Modify `refreshDiscordMember` in `utils\discord\refreshRoles.ts` to sync a new database document that tracks role assignment logic. The document should include `discordMemberId`, `discordServerConfigId`, `shouldHaveRole`, and `date` (timestamp of last change). If `shouldHaveRole` doesn't change, the `date` field should remain the same. The document must be unique for each `discordMemberId` and `discordServerConfigId` combination, requiring the creation of a new table using TypeORM.

## Proposed Actions 🛠???

Here???s a checklist of actions to follow for resolving this issue:

1. **Fork and Create Branch**:  
   Fork the repository and create a new branch using the issue number:
   
```bash
   git checkout -b fix-[issue-number]
```

2. **Implement Changes**:  
- [ ] Create a new TypeORM entity named `DiscordRoleSyncStatus` with fields:
  - `id` (primary key)
  - `discordMemberId`
  - `discordServerConfigId`
  - `shouldHaveRole`
  - `date`
  - Add a unique constraint on `discordMemberId` + `discordServerConfigId`
- [ ] Create a corresponding migration to add the new table
- [ ] Modify `refreshDiscordMember`:
  - [ ] After computing `shouldHaveRole`, upsert a document in `DiscordRoleSyncStatus`
  - [ ] Only update `date` if `shouldHaveRole` value has changed
  - [ ] Ensure existing records are fetched before inserting to compare the previous `shouldHaveRole` value
  - [ ] Add error handling and logging if needed

3. **Run Tests and Commit Changes**:  
   Make sure your changes don't break existing functionality and commit with a clear message:
   
```bash
   git commit -m "Fix: Sync DiscordRoleSyncStatus in refreshDiscordMember function"
```

## Required 📋

To keep our workflow smooth, please make sure you follow these guidelines:

- **Assignment**: Don't create a pull request if you weren???t assigned to this issue.
- **Timeframe**: Complete the task within **3 business days**.
- **Closing the Issue**: In your PR description, close the issue by writing Close #[issue_id].
- **Review Process**:
  - Once you've submitted your PR, change the label to **"ready for review"**.
  - If changes are requested, address them and then update the label back to **"ready for review"** once done.
- **Testing**: Test your PR locally before pushing, and verify that tests and build are working after pushing.

Thank you for your contribution 🙏

?????? WARNING: Failure to follow the requirements above may result in being added to the OnlyDust blacklist, affecting your ability to receive future rewards.

issueDTO.title: Add Instructions to Snake Game for Better User Experience
issueDTO.description:
### Description

While testing the **Snake Game** on the Games Section, I noticed that the game starts **only when an arrow key is pressed**, but this behavior is **not communicated to the user**.

This lack of instructions may confuse users, especially first-time visitors, making the game appear broken or inactive.

---

###  Proposed Enhancement

* Adding a **short instruction message** like:
  *"Press any arrow key to start the game. Use arrow keys to control the snake."*
* Displaying this message in a visible area (e.g., above or below the canvas).
* Including a **"Start" overlay** that disappears when the game begins.

---

### Benefits

* Makes the game more intuitive.
* Reduces user confusion.
* Enhances overall user experience.

---

Its kinda strange that in #11441 you've added `addParameter`, but you did not add `deleteParameter`. This custom data is not always needed to be present, therefore currently the only way to make it happen is to call `addParameter('smth', null)`, which means that i waste some bytes in my database per every sales channel context that has this data added and removed afterwards.

I am able to submit a PR for this.

issueDTO.title: [Bug]: Elasticsearch default compression breaks OpenSearch index creation
issueDTO.description:
### What happened?

Hello,

I am using Jaeger with the OpenSearch storage backend. I am using AWS Opensearch version 2.19.

I recently attempted to upgrade from Jaeger 2.5.0 to 2.6.0, but I have ran into a bug with Index Creation using the opensearch storage backend which is causing my Jaeger service to fail.

This commit https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/commit/1b1cfe205e6e8724718b92dda3f70ed4969c2031 by @timonegk sets the gzip encryption by default, but I do not believe we want this on the call to create the index, rather just on calls which submit traces.

Rolling back to 2.5.0 successfully creates my index.


### Steps to reproduce

Setup latest jaeger 2.6.0 to use an AWS Opensearch storage backend
Attempt to start Jaeger, see failure in OS Index creation.
Roll back to 2.5.0 and see OS Index creation succeed.

### Expected behavior

Index creates successfully and my Jaeger instance turns healthy.

### Relevant log output

```shell
`Error: cannot start pipelines: failed to start "jaeger_storage_exporter" exporter: cannot create trace write: failed to create template "traces-jaeger-span": elastic: Error 500 (Internal Server Error): Compressor detection can only be called on some xcontent bytes or compressed xcontent bytes [type=not_x_content_exception]`
```

### Screenshot

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Jaeger backend version

2.6.0

### SDK

Latest jaeger version attempting to store traces in 2.19 Opensearch AWS.
https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/blob/main/cmd/jaeger/config-opensearch.yaml Use this configuration.

### Pipeline

_No response_

### Stogage backend

AWS OpenSearch

### Operating system

Linux

### Deployment model

ECS

### Deployment configs

```shell

```
comments: Thanks for reporting

Hey @yurishkuro new to Jaeger, would you mind providing a bit more context on this?
Thanks!
I think the issue description is already quite detailed and well researched. What is not clear?
I am actually using Jaeger with AWS OpenSearch as well and index creation works. Could you verify that the compression is at fault by running Jaeger with `--es.http-compression=false` in 2.6.0?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f3b1f1aa-19da-4892-8d6e-29e67fbfdeeb)

That flag does not appear to be working on 2.6.0
@dutchhaag v2 is not configured via flags, there is a corresponding config property

Thank you @yurishkuro . I attempted to set the http compression to false with this block in my config. But still receive the same error.

```
jaeger_storage:
    backends:
      some_storage:
        opensearch:
          server_urls:
            - http://localhost:9200
          http_compression: false #disable compression
          indices:
            index_prefix: "traces"
            spans:
              date_layout: "2006-01-02"
              rollover_frequency: "day"
              shards: 5
              replicas: 1
            services:
              date_layout: "2006-01-02"
              rollover_frequency: "day"
              shards: 5
              replicas: 1
            dependencies:
              date_layout: "2006-01-02"
              rollover_frequency: "day"
              shards: 5
              replicas: 1
            sampling:
              date_layout: "2006-01-02"
              rollover_frequency: "day"
              shards: 5
              replicas: 1
      
```

I was able to successfully create indices by setting `http_compression: false` in my storage configuration. This was in 2.7.0. I think the bug fix will be to disable compression on any index/index_template creation.

> I was able to successfully create indices by setting `http_compression: false` in my storage configuration. This was in 2.7.0. I think the bug fix will be to disable compression on any index/index_template creation.

Hey @dutchhaag if possible can you once please share the configuration you used with which the reported bug was not happening.
@yurishkuro there is pr for ir but no progress for 3 weeks can I work on it ?
@yurishkuro ia this issue still there like i tried but evrything is working fine

>  i tried but evrything is working fine

If possible can you share how you had tested this? By locally running opensearch?

I am not using localhost opensearch storage. I have an AWS OpenSearch cluster and am using this proxy as a sidecar to support sigv4 signing. 
https://github.com/abutaha/aws-es-proxy

I now realize the issue is likely when using this proxy and not the standard method. I have worked around it by disabling http_compression. Would be awesome to have sigv4 support out of the box for AWS OpenSearch.
Yeah I was testing this on local
@yurishkuro Is there any plan to add native SIGv4 signing support in Jaeger for AWS OpenSearch, so users don???t need to rely on external proxies like aws-es-proxy?
No, we only support open standards, not vendor specific APIs.

issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
This is a request from a user received via email. It would be useful to be able to filter downloaded episodes within the podcast details page.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Add a 'Downloaded' option to the Filter episodes list.
comments:
Hi!  I'd love to work on this issue. It looks like a great first issue to get started with. Is there anything i need to be aware of before starting on this issue please let me know...any approaches you would want me to follow?

my approach would be updating the ui by adding a downloaded button that would navigate user to the downloaded episodes for that podcast or overall downloads...

Could you please assign it to me?
I'll start working on it and open a pull request once assigned. Thanks! 🙌

Hi @sandy4242, Yes, sure, I'm happy to assign this to you; however, the issue is more straightforward and wouldn't need an additional button. If you go into the list of episodes for podcast you will see a filter button which allows you to filter episodes: What the user has requested is an additional option of 'Downloaded' in the list, so they can filter downloaded episodes for that podcast. If you would like to go ahead with implementing this, please let me know and I can assign it to you. One thing to be aware of is that you will need to add a new string in the `L.dart` class file for the `Downloaded` option. Please see the [TRANSLATION.md](https://github.com/amugofjava/anytime_podcast_player/blob/master/TRANSLATION.md) file on how Anytime handles translations. For a single word, Google Translate/Bing Translator are useful for translating labels into the supported languages. If you don't feel comfortable handling the translations, don't worry, this can be done later. I do have a really busy couple of weeks coming up and I may be slow to respond to questions and PRs, so please bear with me. Thanks.

issueDTO.title: Make `StructField.physical_name` internal_api
issueDTO.description:
`StructField.physical_name` is currently public. It should be made an internal api for the following reasons:
1) This api can be misused by engines.
2) It exposes delta details such as schema metadata and column mapping (see #1120)
3) In normal use-cases, kernel-rs is the only one that should be converting a logical schema to physical.

repository.description: A native Delta implementation for integration with any query engine
repository.name: delta-kernel-rs

summary.main: Make `StructField.physical_name` internal API
summary.validationOrRequirement: Internal API
summary.otherNotes: This API can be misused by engines, exposes delta details such as schema metadata and column mapping, and is only needed by kernel-rs.

issueDTO.title: Improve Contrast for Application Form Elements to Meet WCAG 2 AA Standards
issueDTO.description: ### Page where problem found? - `/app-form-details` - `/app-form` - `/app-form-additional` - `/app-form-household` - `/app-form-long-text` - `/app-form-reference` - `/app-form-admin` **Note**: The scope is currently limited to these templates, but since the color palette is used across the site, this could lead to a broader, site-wide accessibility improvement ### Description Accessibility testing tools like Axe DevTools and Silktide have identified insufficient color contrast in various elements across all application form templates, including buttons, links, and legends: > Ensure the contrast between foreground and background colors meets WCAG 2 AA minimum contrast ratio thresholds. > Element has insufficient color contrast of 3.59 (foreground color: #0093b5, background color: #ffffff, font size: 14.4pt (19.2px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1 ### Why is this important Ensuring sufficient color contrast is crucial for accessibility, particularly for users with visual impairments, such as low vision or color blindness. Low contrast can make text difficult to read, reducing usability and accessibility for all users, including those using assistive technologies. ### Acceptance Criteria - [ ] All text elements meet WCAG 2 AA contrast guidelines. - [ ] Interactive elements (buttons, links, form fields) have sufficient contrast. - [ ] Updates are tested and verified using accessibility tools. ### Resources - [Color Contrast Anaylzer](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/color-contrast?application=AxeChrome) - [WCAG Guidelines](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20/) - [Silktide](https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/silktide-accessibility-ch/mpobacholfblmnpnfbiomjkecoojakah?hl=en) - [Axe Dev Tools](https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/axe-devtools-web-accessib/lhdoppojpmngadmnindnejefpokejbdd?hl=en) - [WAVE](https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/wave-evaluation-tool/jbbplnpkjmmeebjpijfedlgcdilocofh?hl=en)

issueDTO.title: [UX] Redundant "Quick Links" and "Keep In Touch" Sections on All Pages
issueDTO.description: **Describe the bug** The "Project Vault" website currently features "Quick Links" and "Keep In Touch" sections (including a small contact form snippet) that are repeatedly displayed at the bottom of every page. While a website's footer commonly contains quick links, the prominent and identical repetition of these larger sections on every content page adds significant visual clutter and redundancy. This is particularly noticeable given the presence of a dedicated "Contact Us" page. This structural repetition impacts the overall design coherence and user experience by presenting the same content multiple times, even when a user navigates between different sections of the site. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to the Home page. 2. Scroll to the bottom of the page and observe the "Quick Links" and "Keep In Touch" sections. 3. Navigate to the About Us, FAQ, Contact Us, Webfolio, Games, or ML Projects pages. 4. Scroll to the bottom of each of these pages. 5. **See error**: The identical "Quick Links" and "Keep In Touch" sections are repeated on every page. **Expected behavior** The "Quick Links" and "Keep In Touch" sections should ideally be integrated more strategically within the website's structure to avoid redundancy. This could involve: - Consolidating "Quick Links" into a standard, less prominent footer that appears once. - Removing the repeated "Keep In Touch" section on content pages, directing users to the dedicated "Contact Us" page for inquiries. - Ensuring these elements enhance, rather than detract from, the content of individual pages. **Screenshots** Bottom of About Us Page showing the exact same sections. **Desktop :** - OS: Windows 11 - Browser: Chrome - Version: 136.0.0.0 **Smartphone :** - Device: Galaxy A15 - OS: Android 14 - Browser: Chrome - Version: 138.0.7204.63 **Additional context** This issue is observed across different browsers and on mobile devices as well, indicating a consistent design choice rather than a rendering bug. Addressing this will significantly improve the website's cleanliness and navigation flow.
comments:
I am interested in solving this issue. I have a good grasp on HTML and CSS code structure and use, along with knowing UI/UX design as well. Do consider assigning this to me.

I am Harivallabha Sai Surishetty, a GSSoC'25 contributor.

Thank you!

summary.main: The 'Quick Links' and 'Keep In Touch' sections are repeatedly displayed at the bottom of every page, causing visual clutter and redundancy, and impacting the overall design coherence and user experience.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Consolidate 'Quick Links' into a standard, less prominent footer that appears once, remove the repeated 'Keep In Touch' section on content pages, and ensure these elements enhance, rather than detract from, the content of individual pages.

summary.otherNotes: The issue is observed across different browsers and on mobile devices, indicating a consistent design choice rather than a rendering bug.

issueDTO.title: Make `StructField.physical_name` take ColumnMappingMod
issueDTO.description:
`StructField.physical_name` always uses the column mapping physical name if it is present in the metadata. However, we must be aware of the column mapping mode when setting the physical name. For instance, a StructField containing physical name metadata must still use the logical name if the column mapping mode is None.


A successful implementation would: Make physical name take ColumnMappingMode parameter, and produce the correct name based on the mode

Context [here](https://github.com/delta-io/delta-kernel-rs/pull/1082/files#r2223819058).

repository.description: A native Delta implementation for integration with any query engine
repository.name: delta-kernel-rs

summary.main: Make `StructField.physical_name` take ColumnMappingMode parameter and produce the correct name based on the mode
summary.validationOrRequirement: The column mapping mode must be considered when setting the physical name
summary.attemptedFixes: No attempted fixes or blockers are mentioned in the description
summary.otherNotes: The context of this issue can be found in the pull request #1082

There is no way to see that maintenance mode is starting.
It does not show on the status page nor in the uptime monitor itself.
only on the Maintenance page status

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I come from uptime kuma
And where maintenance mode starts, all monitors that are set to maintenance mode change state to "maintenance mode"
And also on the status page, you can see this very clearly. And the admin can also add a message
like ETA of return to service, etc.
I would be happy if there was a possibility, for example, that maintenance mode starts, the monitor will change to "maintenance mode - up" so that it will still check but will not send notifications

Thanks!!

issueDTO.title: Evaluate project criteria is clear
issueDTO.description:
### Page where problem found?

## Full Time Programs' Project Links:
- Week 1. Recipe Page ([phase 1](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/recipe-page/phase-1-html-prompt.md) & [phase 2](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/recipe-page/phase-2-css-prompt.md))

- Week 3. Portfolio / Resume Page ([phase 1](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/portfolio/portfolio-webpage-1.md), [phase 2](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/portfolio/portfolio-webpage-2.md), [phase 3](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/portfolio/portfolio-webpage-3.md))
- Week 4. [Games App](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/js-html-games.md) (JavaScript)
- Week 5. [Games App](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/react-game.md) (React)
- Week 6. [RESTful API](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/rest-api-project.md)
- Week 7. [Weather App](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/weather-app.md)
- Week 8. [Game/Quiz App](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/week8GameREADME.md) (Testing Introduced)
- Week 9. [Eventonica](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/tree/main/projects/eventonica-updated)
- Week 10. [Endangered Animals](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/mern-pern-project.md)
- Week 11. 2 mini projects in 1 week! [Contact List](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/pern-contact-list-app.md) and choice of [Weather App](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/pern-weather-app.md) or [Game App](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/blob/main/projects/pern-game-app.md)
- Week 12. [Blog App](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/tree/main/projects/blog-app)
- Weeks 13 - 18. [Final Project](https://github.com/Techtonica/curriculum/tree/main/projects/final-project)

### Type of problem

Some participants find themselves confused about what is required of each project and what will be evaluated

### Suggested Solution

- [ ] Evaluate each week's project README. 
- [ ] Ensure all project requirements are clearly stated and its clear what is required of the project, ensure that it is clear the areas that staff will be evaluating. 
- [ ] Best practice should be clearly stated as apart of requirements
    - [ ] committing frequently, 
    - [ ] participating in PR code reviews and feedback iteration, 
    - [ ] collaboration, 
    - [ ] clean code and formatting

  3. Add support for tags in the import API endpoint
For client changes,
  1. Update ImportActivitiesDialog to fetch available tags
  2. Add UI for selecting/mapping tags in the import workflow (similar to account handling)
  3. Add tag parsing to ImportActivitiesService for CSV/JSON imports
  4. Update template to include tag selector component in the import dialog 

The implementation would mirror how account handling works in the current import flow. Should I apply this or do you have any other suggestions to solve this?
Sorry, I haven???t been able to focus due to some personal busyness. Good luck @teresper-eth!
Thanks @gormelof !  @dtslvr  Could you kindly tell me if I should follow this approach ?

Hi @teresper-eth,

thanks for outlining your approach!

I don't think we need to update the `ImportActivitiesDialog`. The idea is to handle the tag processing entirely on the backend, similar to how it's currently done for accounts during import. So, the client wouldn't need to fetch or map tags explicitly.

The rest of your plan sounds like the right direction.

Refactor base.html to move <script> block into external JavaScript file

# Description:

The `base.html` template currently contains a `<script> `block at the bottom of the file with logic. To improve code organization and follow separation of concerns, we should extract this script into a standalone JavaScript file under `static/js/`.

# Tasks:
 - [ ] Create a new JS file in `static/js/`
 - [ ] Move the contents of the `<script>` block from the bottom of `templates/base.html` into that file
 - [ ] Link the new file to the template Ensure the JS is wrapped in DOMContentLoaded if not already
 - [ ] Keep the code behavior identical???no UX changes

# Out of Scope:

- [ ] Refactoring JavaScript from other templates (handle those in separate issues)
- [ ] Changing styles or interactions
- [ ] Replacing or removing functionality

issueDTO.title: Maintenance: Add Error Handling Decorator to Telemetry Client Functions
issueDTO.description:
## Description

We need to implement a try/catch decorator for all functions in the [TelemetryClient ](https://github.com/aws-deadline/deadline-cloud/blob/mainline/src/deadline/client/api/_telemetry.py#L58)class to ensure robust error handling and prevent any telemetry-related issues from affecting the main application flow.

## Current Behavior:

Some functions in the TelemetryClient class have basic error handling, for example, the [`initialize()`](https://github.com/aws-deadline/deadline-cloud/blob/mainline/src/deadline/client/api/_telemetry.py#L162) method silently catches all exceptions.

However, other methods may throw uncaught exceptions that could impact the application

## Proposed Changes:

### Create a decorator that will:

- Catch all exceptions
- Log errors appropriately
- Prevent exceptions from propagating to calling code
- Maintain the telemetry client's non-blocking nature

### Functions requiring the decorator:

- `set_opt_out()`
- `initialize()`
- `_get_prefixed_endpoint()`
- `_get_telemetry_identifier()`
- `_start_threads()`
- `_get_system_metadata()`
- `_exit_cleanly()`
- `_send_request()`

issueDTO.title: [Feature]: integrate Google OAuth Login
issueDTO.description:
### 📝 Feature Description

Allow users to log in to DocMagic using their Google account, improving convenience and security.

Tasks
 Set up a Google Cloud Project.

 Configure the OAuth consent screen (add project name, support email, and developer details).

 Create OAuth 2.0 credentials (choose "Web Application" as the application type).

 Add your site's domain (e.g., https://doc-magic-heob.vercel.app/) as an Authorized redirect URI.

 Store the Google Client ID (and Secret, if using a backend) securely in environment variables.

 Implement frontend "Login with Google" button and initiate OAuth 2.0 login flow.

 Handle the OAuth callback to receive an authorization code or token.

 Fetch user profile info and complete authentication in DocMagic.

 Add error handling for common OAuth issues (e.g., denied permission, token expiration).

 Clearly display any required app verification warnings if using unverified scopes.

Acceptance Criteria
Users can log in or sign up using their Google account.

The authentication process is secure (no credential leakage; use HTTPS).

Appropriate error messages are shown for failed logins.

Only users with verified emails (if required) are permitted access.

Labels: auth enhancement google-oauth
Priority: High

References
[Using OAuth 2.0 to Access Google APIs](https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/oauth2)

[Web Application OAuth Setup Steps](https://www.instantdb.com/docs/auth/google-oauth)

[Integrating Google OAuth 2.0 User Authentication](https://www.unipile.com/integrating-google-oauth-2-0-user-authentication-into-your-app/)

### 💡 Why is this feature needed?

_No response_

### 📎 Additional Context

_No response_
