issueDTO.title: feat: Bump the dependencies of wasmedge-ffmpeg, ffmpeg to 7.1 'P??ter' (LTS)
issueDTO.description:
### Summary

Previously, the wasmedge-ffmpeg plugin used ffmpeg 6.0, which is already EOL. It's not possible to ask our users to install a legacy version of ffmpeg, especially since it will require users to build from the source.

To fix this, we have to decide to use the latest LTS version, 7.1, which is in active maintenance mode.

I believe API changes will be between the current version, 6.0.0, and the new version (7.1.1). So, the current implementation of the wasmedge-ffmpeg plugin will also need to be modified.


### Details

The following action items should be finished:

- [ ] Update to the new ffmpeg version 7.1.1
- [ ] Modify the implementation of wasmedge-ffmpeg
- [ ] Ensure the CI passes for building and testing

### Appendix

_No response_

issueDTO.title: Let's document: VBoxManage
issueDTO.description:
### Command description

VBoxManage is the CLI of Oracle VM VirtualBox, it includes every control from VirtualBox GUI as well as more features.

Currently, there is a page [vboxmanage](https://github.com/tldr-pages/tldr/blob/main/pages/common/vboxmanage.md) covering a few commands of VBoxManage but a lot of useful commands are still missing.

We could create subpages to document other commands and maybe refactor the current page using the Subcommand instruction from [contributing](https://github.com/tldr-pages/tldr/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Documentation

https://www.virtualbox.org/manual/ch08.html

### Platform

Common

### Commands

issueDTO.title: New audit: comments next to explicit permissions
issueDTO.description:
This would be a good pedantic/auditor-only (probably the latter) audit: when a workflow/job has a `permissions:` block, each explicit permission in that block should have an explanatory comment.

For example, this should flag the first permission but not the second:

```yaml
permissions:
  contents: write
  id-token: write # for frobulating
```
comments: I'd be happy to try it, but it might take a while, to be frank; will take a stab if it's acceptable.

That's no problem at all! Let me know if you have any questions about the codebase or how to approach this -- it'll probably be a bit different from the other audits, since it'll need to operate over the `Workflow` model but also jump down (via `yamlpath`) to each permission's comments.

For transparency - I remember and I'm still interested, but I forgot summer is a vacation season in Europe, so dealing with quite a bit.
The audit rule will be conquered! (eventually)

issueDTO.title: Rethink `FeaturesSection` on Website - Design for Mobile
issueDTO.description:
The `FeaturesSection` component (located in
`apps/website/src/components/LandingPage/FeaturesSection/index.tsx`) currently renders well on desktop, but on **mobile devices**, it presents two main issues:

1. **Poor Rendering:**
   The layout does not adapt well to small screens, making the section hard to read and visually inconsistent with the rest of the landing page.

2. **High Processing Load:**
   The animations, layout structure, or component complexity seem to require too much processing for mobile devices, potentially leading to frame drops or sluggish scroll performance.


Rethink the FeaturesSection design to improve mobile rendering and reduce performance overhead on low-powered devices.

issueDTO.title: Add Support for Text-Only Tiles
issueDTO.description:
**Description:**

I would like to suggest a feature to enhance board customization in Cboard: the ability to create **tiles containing only text**, without any symbol or image.

**Feature Requirements:**

* If a user **does not select a symbol or image** when creating a new tile, the tile should automatically default to a **text-only tile**.
* For **text-only tiles**, the text should be displayed in a **standard font style (not bold)**.

**Why This Matters:**

This feature would enhance accessibility and customization for:

* Users with strong **literacy skills** who prefer reading over symbols.
* Users who rely on **alternative access methods** like eye-gaze or switch scanning, where cleaner layouts and clear text alignment improve usability.

Allowing flexible control over text display makes Cboard more inclusive and adaptable to various communication needs.
comments:
Hi @martinbedouret  
I???d like to work on this issue. Could you please assign it to me or let me know if I can proceed?  
Thanks!

thanks @Harshit-Mourya ! I have updated the implementation to make it simple. Text size, font, and alignment must be general settings from the display options in the settings page. 
You are assigned.

Thanks @martinbedouret for assigning the issue!
I???ll start working on it shortly and will keep you posted on the progress.

issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
When in Spanner Studio for the GCP dashboard, I expect to be able to quickly delete a feature row by selecting the row and hitting the delete button. But that is not possible.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to the [data](https://pantheon.corp.google.com/spanner/instances/staging-spanner/databases/staging-database/tables/WebFeatures/details/data?project=webstatus-dev-internal-staging) section in GCP
2. Find the row I want to delete
3. Select the checkbox and hit delete at the top
4. I get this error: `Foreign key constraint violation when deleting or updating referenced row(s): referencing row(s) found in table "BrowserFeatureAvailabilities".`
5. As a result, I have to manually delete things in reverse order with this kind of script in [Spanner Studio](https://pantheon.corp.google.com/spanner/instances/staging-spanner/databases/staging-database/details/query;showWriteDdlOptInBanner=true?project=webstatus-dev-internal-staging):
```sql
-- Delete from WPTRunFeatureMetrics
DELETE FROM WPTRunFeatureMetrics WHERE WebFeatureID = 'IDHERE';

-- Delete from BrowserFeatureAvailabilities
DELETE FROM BrowserFeatureAvailabilities WHERE WebFeatureID = 'IDHERE';

-- Delete from FeatureBaselineStatus
DELETE FROM FeatureBaselineStatus WHERE WebFeatureID = 'IDHERE';

-- Delete from FeatureSpecs
DELETE FROM FeatureSpecs WHERE WebFeatureID = 'IDHERE';

-- Finally, delete the web feature itself
DELETE FROM WebFeatures WHERE ID = 'IDHERE';
```

**Expected behavior**
1. Go to the [data](https://pantheon.corp.google.com/spanner/instances/staging-spanner/databases/staging-database/tables/WebFeatures/details/data?project=webstatus-dev-internal-staging) section in GCP
2. Find the row I want to delete
3. Select the checkbox and hit delete at the top
4. Delete successful


**Additional context**
This is meant for permanently deleting features. There is a workaround using the script above. But this would be a one button click if these tables had ON DELETE CASCADE.

For temporarily hiding, we can continue to use the ExcludeFeatures table. That should not be touched

issueDTO.title: Detect when features are deleted in web-features
issueDTO.description:
Our ingestion process should detect when a web feature is deleted (whether it be from an actual deletion or rename).

The process should remove that web feature from the various tables.

In the event of a rename, this process should not try to connect the old identifier's data to the new web feature identifier. (This excludes the case of where the [alias](https://github.com/web-platform-dx/web-features/blob/5cb42fac46315d11e4e06604d89094a46de953a9/types.ts#L11) field is used and will be addressed in a separate issue)

Without this, the team will need to continually monitor the releases for web-features and see if there are any removals or renames and manually add them to the exclude table.

cc: @foolip
comments: Depends on #513

issueDTO.title: Automate common text transforms.
issueDTO.description:
### Description

There are a number of text transformations that amount to repetitive tasks commonly done by authors. To give one example, if I'm quoting a brief passage that contains quotation marks???

> During this time the  meanings of "liveness" and "presence" were indistinguishable from Western discourses of modernization.

???I'll need to convert the double-quotes used in the quotation to single-quotes in my paper, like so:

> Lisa Parks argues that "during this time the  meanings of 'liveness' and 'presence' were indistinguishable from Western discourses of modernization."

This sort of thing can be done by hand or with find-replace (if find-in-region were a thing in Zettlr; see #4040). But it's also the sort of yak shaving/repetitive task that cries out for automation, particularly when using a tool like Zettlr that contains other features of advanced text editors.

### Proposed Changes

Many programming text editors contain a menu or sub-menu from which users can select text transformations that are common in programming, such as changing tabs to spaces, toggling upper and lower case characters, straightening quotes, etc. For instance, BBEdit has a killer `Text` menu:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/caa059ea-7846-462f-8763-fa0e57431161)

I'm suggesting that Zettlr add a similar menu or sub-menu populated with text transformations that are common in academic or journalistic writing. These could include:

- Double quotes to single quotes. (See above.)
- Single quotes to double quotes.
- Italics to quotes (e.g., for changing `_Cultures in Orbit_` to `"Cultures in Orbit"` to satisfy a different style guide.)
- Quotes to italics.
- Join lines (a.k.a. unfill-region, see #4039)
- Sentence case to title case.
- Title case to sentence case.

???and possibly others.

Possible locations for these menu items could include the edit menu (or a sub-menu under the edit menu), the right-click context menu when text is selected in the editor, or a top-of-screen toolbar button. Some of the most commonly used transforms might also be given their own keyboard shortcuts.

### Caveats

None.

### Do you Wish to Attempt Implementing this Yourself?

No

### Zettlr Version

Nightly

### Your Platform

- [ ] Windows
- [ ] macOS
- [x] Linux

### Operating System Version

Manjaro (Rolling)

### Additional Information

_No response_
comments:
I keep finding more transforms that would be useful.

- Text cut-and-pasted from PDFs sometimes has extra spaces in weird places, so "strip duplicate spaces" could be useful.
- Straighten quotes would be very useful, since text cut-and-pasted from Word documents and from PDFs often contains smart quotes that aren't needed in markdown.
- I occasionally find article or book PDFs where the page designer has replaced double quotes with pairs of individual single quotes (e.g., '' instead of "). Similarly, text cut and pasted from LaTeX documents will often have pairs of single quotes and/or backticks in place of double-quotes. A transform that converted paired single quotes and paired backticks to double-quotes would come in handy from time to time.
- Different style guides advise for or against using spaces on either side of emdashes. A transform would make it simple to toggle from one to the other.

Im gonna add a good first issue label here, because the bulk of the work only involves writing appropriate CodeMirror commands. Tying them to a context menu or keyboard shortcuts is then trivial. So anyone who wants to learn how CodeMirror commands work is invited. @wideaperture would you mind collecting your suggestions in an easy to parse task list so that people can pick and choose? Maybe even create subissues on this one, if that works?

Sounds good, thanks for putting this on the roadmap! Here's the list of tasks, which I will link to the related sub-issues, once these are created.

- Straighten quotes. (Convert `??? ??? ??? ???` to `" ' ' "`.) #5675
- Double quotes to single quotes (Convert `"` to `'`.) #5676
- Single quotes to double quotes (Convert `'` to `"`.) #5676
- Italics to quotes (Convert italicized text, like `_Cultures in Orbit_` to quoted text, like `"Cultures in Orbit"`) #5677
- Quotes to italics (Convert quoted text, like `"Cultures in Orbit"` to italicized text, like `_Cultures in Orbit_`) #5677
- Join lines. #4039
- Sentence case to title case. #5678
- Title case to sentence case. #5678
- Strip duplicate spaces. (Convert `technical things  have political qualities` to `technical things have political qualities`) #5679
- Paired quotes to double quotes. (Convert ` `` ` and `''` to `"`) #5680
- Add spaces around emdashes (Convert `???contended???in a curious mixing of metaphors` to `???contended ??? in a curious mixing of metaphors`) #5681
- Strip spaces around emdashes (Convert `???contended ??? in a curious mixing of metaphors` to `???contended???in a curious mixing of metaphors`) #5681
- Create a sub-menu, `Transform`, for text transforms like those above that appears in the `Edit` menu and/or in the right-click context menu for selected text in the editor.
Thank you! I have now added the corresponding label to each of them. Maybe we can share the workload with new contributors!
Thank you so much! Would it help if I provided some regular expressions for the various transforms? I???m not savvy enough to contribute to the code base, but I???m at least handy with regex.
Definitely, but regex is not suitable for everything. And for some others, it may be easier to do it manually. But I guess it won't hurt to think about that!
True! I can see how native functions and/or simple find-replace strings could work for many, if not most, of these.

Well, regex is native, too :D I'm just always hesitant to use them in instances where simpler things may work too, because Regex adds quite some overhead in terms of parsing. Although, for commands that are invoked consciously and not on every keypress this is probably worrying too much on my side!
Github just added sub issue management on mobile -- I've now added your issues as sub issues here so that it's hopefully even easier to find!
Fantastic, thank you! I think the older #4039 may also be a sub-issue of this now.
Good catch, added!

@richdouglasevans and @nathanlesage ??? As promised, here is a composite PDF from which you can glean text to test the various transforms.

Below are the representative passages for cutting and pasting. I notice that the cut-and-paste behavior differs somewhat depending on the PDF viewer from which the text is copied to the clipboard. Zotero's on-board PDF viewer, for example, seems to replace line breaks with extra spaces, while other PDF viewers introduce hard wraps for each line of text. In any case, here goes:

This passage from Lisa Parks' _Cultures in Orbit_ demonstrates #5680 (paired quotes to double quotes):

```
Our World???s structure established precedents for subsequent
global television coverage, alternating between live views of the television

Seen by millions of viewers throughout North America and Europe, this
early experiment helped to determine one of the cultural forms of satellite
television.
```

When I paste it from Zotero's PDF viewer, instead of the hard wraps, I get #5679 (duplicate spaces):

```
Our World???s structure established precedents for subsequent  global television coverage, alternating between live views of the television  studio, maps, and remote locations, interpellating the viewer not only as  ??????globally present?????? but as ??????culturally worldly?????? and ??????geographically mobile.??????  Seen by millions of viewers throughout North America and Europe, this  early experiment helped to determine one of the cultural forms of satellite  television.
```

This passage from Evans and Ludgren's _No Heavenly Bodies_ has some wicked hard wraps that could be resolved with #4039 / unfill-region (Zotero again changes these wraps to duplicate spaces):

```
The launch of Sputnik and Yuri Gagarin???s flight, of course, ??were impor??tant
landmarks of the Space Race and widely considered to be significant victo-
ries for the Soviet ??Union during the Cold War. 2 However, the act of broad-
casting Gagarin???s return to Moscow to audiences in Western ?? E
urope was not
an example of unidirectional propaganda, but rather a cooperative effort
by broadcasters in both the Soviet U
 ?? nion and ??Europe.3
```

This passage from Patrick Robert Parsons' _Blue Skies_ has more hard wraps, as well as smart quotes, both single and double, to be straightened (#5675). Once straightened, the quotes could also be used to test #5686 (converting between double and single quotes). It also has an emdash with no spaces around it (#5681): 

```
The consumer could choose from
three-inch tubes to ???giant??? twenty-inch screens, as well as direct view pic-
ture tubes or early ???projection screen??? receivers. None of the sets were cheap.
Prices ranged from $99 to nearly $5,000 for custom-built models.12 The av-
erage selling price was around $575 in 1947 and, although prices came down
a bit each year, it was still a costly adventure.13 As historians Christopher
Sterling and Michael Kittross noted: ???The typical 5-inch to 7-inch receiver
cost from $375 to $500 in mid-1948???several weeks??? pay for the average
worker. 
```

And the excerpt of the interview with Whitney Phillips from Nieman Lab contains emdashes that do have spaces around them (#5681):

```
Our world is awash in mis- and disinformation. Conspiratorial thinking
and misguided beliefs and attitudes towards science are widespread. But
combatting this deluge of problematic information must be done with care.
Too often, argues Whitney Phillips, we dismiss the people who consume or
propagate such information as irrational. In fact, given the experiences
they may have been having on the internet for many years ??? or what they
may have been encountering via traditional media for decades ??? their
views, troubling as they may be, may in many cases be perfectly rational.
```

[TransformExamples.pdf](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19493251/TransformExamples.pdf)

Love it @wideaperture ??????

It's immediately thrown up stuff 🥳 For example, the excerpt from Evans and Ludgren's _No Heavenly Bodies_ includes some unwanted line breaks... I ran the command in my dev version of Zettlr and they're removed. Sadly, the text has some "funky" whitespace that confounds the existing transforms.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4c7bff1e-a9f1-475d-a871-a6d8908ecc7b)

That "whitespace" is `SPACE` + `SOFT HYPHEN` ([?](https://www.ascii-code.com/CP1252/173)) + `SPACE`.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/74d612bf-92f4-4a11-ac2f-de86b75e4f54

I'll leave it to you and Hendrik to decide _What_ to do here; perhaps there's a composite transform called `Zap Gremlins` that does a whole bunch of cleanup on a selected block of text:

* remove unwanted line breaks
* strip duplicate spaces
* remove any soft hyphens, hairline spaces, that sort of thing
* more?

In any case, GREAT! Having real data to work with is fantabulosa ??????

Thank you, @richdouglasevans! I love the idea of a `Zap Gremlins` option. Another Zettlr-adjacent app, Scrivener, [seems to have this feature](https://forum.literatureandlatte.com/t/what-is-zap-gremlins/44999/2), so some users may already be familiar with it:

> Text Tidying ??? Zap Gremlins Strips Unicode and ASCII control characters from the selection. If you are having difficulties compiling, or have found areas in your text where the cursor seems to get ???stuck??? when moving through ranges of text, your document may have acquired these invisible control characters from somewhere. This command will strip out all of the Unicode characters falling within the range of #x00 to #x1F, save for the necessary #x09, #x0A, #x0C and #X0D characters, which are used to print spaces, line returns, page breaks and tabs in your text.

I haven't used Scrivener in something like 12 years, so I had no idea they had implemented this. It seems, in fact, like we've independently arrived at [nearly all the same features](https://www.literatureandlatte.com/blog/clean-up-your-texts-with-scrivener):

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0ecb032c-e896-4f17-a53d-f39ff569010c)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e3869737-f59d-42d8-a3e8-dc77cd3813ff)

I think the only (relevant, non-word processor-y) ones not on our list are `Zap Gremlins`, `Strip Leading Tabs/Spaces`, `Make Uppercase`, and `Make Lowercase`.

@nathanlesage Any sense of when these features might be code-reviewed/merged? I know you have more important things going on, so no worries. I'm just triaging different manuscript tasks and this would be such a significant time saver, that there's some stuff I might put off until it's available.

Thank you, as always!!

* #5701

I have implemented all of the transforms _locally_ ??? the various videos showcasing the editor integration attest to that ??? but I have not raised PRs for them because:

> I'm using this PR to both flush out the approach and learn any things about contributing to this codebase. If all goes well I'll implement the other text transforms secure in the knowledge that the approach has been signed-off by Hendrik (and others) and any "dumb" first-time contributor stuff is sorted.

In your comment on that PR you expressed a potential reservation about the approach taken; [you wrote](https://github.com/Zettlr/Zettlr/pull/5701#issuecomment-2772653913):

> I'll have to think if it's really adequate to have the transform commands implemented using a factory style.

The other twelve or so transforms all use the exact same approach; I am loathe to raise twelve or more PRs only to receive a review comment along the lines of _"This approach is inadequate."_ You know what I mean? :D

Mmm 🤔 What I'll do is raise exactly one more PR for another transform so that you can see how the approach works across two distinct transforms. I will action any review comments you leave and, hopefully, PRs for the remaining transforms will flow in quickly with (relatively) minimal review required because the approach has been signed-off.

I'll raise that PR tomorrow and then reply to this conversation with a sorted list of exactly two PRs ??????
Sounds good! Thanks for sticking with me, even if it took a while 🙈

I've updated the single existing PR with another commit. * #5701 I've done another commit as opposed to another PR because this work is still "up in the air" about the approach. The approach might be rubbish in which case deleting one PR and branch is easier than two PRs and two branches. For the reviewer -- Hendrik I reckon 😄 -- I suggest starting in the `transforms` directory: each transform is implemented in its own file. If we go ahead with this approach there will eventually be 12+ distinct transform files in this directory. The `transform-selected-text.ts` [file](https://github.com/Zettlr/Zettlr/pull/5701/commits/22720ecb402506888a02907f14727b2fa221962a#diff-c8b72e744c4ad2c580752e458bcf587e1990c8c8d87d5b0ef4d0bb0886ddcc88R39) contains the machinery for all these transforms: the `transformSelectedText` higher-order function accepts some transformation function -- it doesn't care what the specifics of the transformations are -- and it handles all the CodeMirror machinery. This leaves the implementation for each transform free to focus on just doing the transform: * the `stripDuplicateSpaces` transform [is trivial](https://github.com/Zettlr/Zettlr/pull/5701/files#diff-f8e8885cfb2144e5180d7d5d6dfb15c4dcb19151b1e0cf2833a6281538246534R16): the JSDoc is longer than the implementation. * the `italicsToQuotes` [transform](https://github.com/Zettlr/Zettlr/pull/5701/files#diff-26c049ca247b0a5c20b97524cf86d333cf7a28ef5d727ade068ec5909cd80c09R16) is the most "complicated" transform which is why I chose to include it as the only other transform in this PR. It uses Hendrik's existing AST code in the implementation following a steer from Hendrik. The other transforms are somewhere between these two in terms of implementation complexity. (Many are one-liners.) They all use the `transformSelectedText` higher-order function which does not change across all 12+ transformations. Each transformation has unit tests: indeed, the unit test code dwarfs the implementation code. There are some outstanding questions around I18N and, I think, around adding these transformation commands to the app's menu somewhere. (Currently the transforms are only exposed via the context menu.)

> Hiya [@wideaperture](https://github.com/wideaperture) and [@richdouglasevans](https://github.com/richdouglasevans) -- I know this issue has been open a bit, but I really do want to fast-track this now.
>

Right, all the transforms are "in" locally. ``` $ git lp 0f945c35d9dc6fd3f8afe8afd0369ce6f75a9c1a (HEAD -> 5659-automate-text-transforms) feat: add transform to title-case text bddf3a004dbdf43e377361e79c3f27abd46be111 feat: add transform to zap gremlins 694ee7afeead1041e5947932be308c13a0b019d1 feat: add transform to sentence-case text 21694febe608f3115b064728056fb04ad3c11d39 feat: add transform to paired quotes to double quotes 8dc0a094c9e18e5edf58005d06856337645a8318 feat: add transform to convert quotes to italics eb25f8b3cbd9f2adac30b9ff80dec6463b1ccc40 feat: add transform to convert curly quotes to straight quotes b15710f8a5e97fc5a6caa3c483b2b1885fad0c9c feat: add transform to convert single quotes to double quotes 46a4073156395c14e48423c2449ac1aefdedddb2 feat: add transform to convert double quotes to single quotes 58885d4ae7d42cd109f82344da843e0d5fb3535b chore: fix lint issues f9f7e687ae2718d344c50a9e548214844db9a04c feat: add transform to remove spaces around emdashes d9035143ca17d441d48be748558c16d247f03b63 feat: add transform to add spaces around emdashes e3164d1e559ceea6d747442e301cca642a467174 feat: add transform to remove line breaks ec19edc4608f809621b472b44e58da84ca4b3d7c feat: Add transform to change italics to quotes 4e686f4c7523f3c7667b2d71fc4e51c26747c684 feat: Add transform to strip duplicate spaces ``` I haven't pushed only because I want to do a spot of manual testing (locally) using the documents that @wideaperture provided for such testing. I'll push this stuff up sometime tomorrow.

issueDTO.title: [Enhancement] Support Expression List Partition
issueDTO.description:
### Search before asking

- [x] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/doris/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.


### Description

see https://doris.apache.org/zh-CN/docs/dev/table-design/data-partitioning/auto-partitioning for our auto partition function now. and in future we need to support arbitrary list expression partitoin. that is,
`partition by list (x, y, z)`
which `x`, `y`, `z` are all any expression which could be constant-folded in FE with exactly one column each one.

### Solution

1. you need to support relative parse rules in nereids. it's in `DorisParser.g4`.
2. you need to remove all restriction of expressions in partitionExprs.
3. you need to make sure it's could be passed to BE and calculated in it. in `vrow_distribution.cpp`, around `part_funcs[i]->execute`.
4. make sure partition prune could process it proper. if we change a range auto partition to list expression partition, the prune result should be as excellent as it. In nereids, the key of partition prune is in `PartitionPruner.java`. you should read it and understand its details completely. the key function is `canBePrunedOut`.

### Are you willing to submit PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)
comments:
I'm still quite unfamiliar with the Doris codebase, so I haven't decided whether to take on this issue yet. However, I have some suggestions regarding modifications to partition pruning. 

1. For single-column partitions, we can simply use the column value itself as the partition identifier and apply the partitionPredicate to the partition identifier column during pruning. 
2. For multi-column partitions, we can use a `List<a, b, ...>` as the partition identifier, and during pruning, pass a corresponding `List<Pred1, Pred2, ...>`, using two nested for loops for pruning: the outer loop iterates over the partition identifier columns, and the inner loop applies the predicates Pred to each element of the partition identifier list. 

Another question I have is whether the current design addresses this???When pruning for an SQL statement like `WHERE colA=xxx AND colB=xxx`, does the partitionPredicate passed in accurately match the columns used in partitioning, rather than passing all predicates from the SQL statement and comparing them one by one.
please assign to me???I'ill try my best to complete it  :)

repository.description: Apache Doris is an easy-to-use, high performance and unified analytics database.
repository.name: doris

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to support expression list partition in Doris, which allows for partitioning by a list of expressions, each with exactly one column.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires supporting relative parse rules in Nereids, removing restrictions on expressions in partitionExprs, and making sure the partition can be passed to BE and calculated in it. It also requires ensuring partition prune can process it properly.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author has suggested some modifications to partition pruning, including using the column value itself as the partition identifier and using a List for multi-column partitions. There is also a question about the accuracy of the partitionPredicate.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to supporting list expression partition in Doris, and the author has some suggestions for modifications to partition pruning. There are also some questions about the current design and its accuracy.

issueDTO.title: Radio button not centered on primeng.org
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the bug

This is regarding an issue I believe was wrongly closed: https://github.com/primefaces/primeng/issues/7873

Me and others in my organization all have this same issue where the radio button inner circle isn't centered. Attached is a video of the bug in action, this becomes especially noticable when zooming in or out. I was able to recreate this also in the attached Stackblitz repos.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/74c06c5b-460d-40ef-b3f6-b16952947e20

### Pull Request Link

_No response_

### Reason for not contributing a PR

- [ ] Lack of time
- [ ] Unsure how to implement the fix/feature
- [ ] Difficulty understanding the codebase
- [x] Other

### Other Reason

I am sadly not knowledgable enough to know how to correct this. I don't even know what causes this. If it helps I found a similar bug solved on a different component library: https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/pull/6097/files

### Reproducer

https://stackblitz.com/edit/github-ze9i24ka-z8m17tsk?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html

### Environment

My display resolution is 1920x1080 with a scale of 125%. Changing scale or resolution didn't do anything. However on my 4k screen the button seems to always have a centered inner circle.



### Angular version

19

### PrimeNG version

v19

### Node version

_No response_

### Browser(s)

Microsoft Edge for Business Version 132.0.2957.140, Firefox 135.0

### Steps to reproduce the behavior

1. Go to https://primeng.org/radiobutton or provided Stackblitz repos
2. Change preset to Material (this theme shows it the most obvious)
3. Zoom in and out (ctrl + scroll), you should see the button not be centered anymore. 

### Expected behavior

The button inner circle should stay centered.
comments:
I can confirm this still happening.
I'm using `Angular 19.1.0` with `primeng 19.0.7`.

When zooming in (or in large resolution screens) the misalignment is very tolerable.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c7669a5f-1c45-4425-ae9b-455cb57e8ebc)

That is sadly not the case in 1080p screens with 100% zoom. 
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43b39cb6-6545-4192-98d1-4f639959b8e6)

The prints were taken in Firefox but the problem also happens on other browsers (chromium).

Due to PrimeTek's demanding roadmap for PrimeNG, this issue is available for anyone to work on. [**Make sure to reference this issue in your pull request.**](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) :sparkles: Thank you for your contribution! :sparkles:

#17305 
I had a similar, if not the same, issue, perhaps the same reason, that it wasn't the browser or OS that was causing it, but the resolutions.

I think I found out why it works this way.

#### Aura/Nora themes
Sizes for outer and inner circle are specified in _rem_. Outer size is _1.25rem_, inner is _0.75rem_. Font size is _14px_, outer size is _1.25*14px=17.5px_, inner is _0.75*14px=10.5px_. And offset of the inner circle from sides should be _(17.5px-10.5px)/2=3.5px_. When radio button is rendered, these values are rounded. Not sure how browsers decide whether to round up or down, but it may be inconsistent. E.g., I would expect the size of the outer circle to be either _17x17_ or _18x18_, but it is actually _18x17_. So, sometimes not only the inner circle is not centered, but the size of the circles is incorrect.

#### Material theme
Here sizes are specified in _px_. Outer circle size is _20px_, inner circle size is _10px_. This would work fine, but inner circle also has _"transform: scale(1,1)"_, which causes rounding errors in Firefox for some reason (but not in Chrome). After changing to _"transform: none"_ it works fine.

#### Lara theme
Outer circle is _21x21_, inner is _14x14_. It cannot be centered.
i would like to work on this issue

issueDTO.title: [Feature request] Allow Type Inference Without Shape Inference in ONNX
issueDTO.description:
### System information

Top of tree.

### What is the problem that this feature solves?

Currently, ONNX???s `shape_inference.infer_shapes` API performs both type and shape inference simultaneously. Type inference is guaranteed in a valid model, but shape inference is on "best effort" basis. For some operators (e.g., GridSample, Gather, Reshape, Where, etc), shape inference may fail due to incomplete or complex shape logic, even when type inference could succeed. 
This tight coupling prevents users from recovering type information when shape inference is unsupported or fails. For example, when users attempt to inject cast nodes or quantize nodes and propagate the type information downstream.


**Request:**
Please consider adding an option to ONNX???s shape inference API to:
- Run type inference independently of shape inference, so that type information can be propagated even when shape inference fails or is not implemented for an operator.
- Alternatively, relax the requirement that shape inference must succeed for type inference to run.

**Benefits:**
- Enables users and downstream tools to recover and validate type information in more models, improving robustness and usability.
- Reduces manual workarounds (such as manually setting types for affected nodes).
- Makes ONNX models more portable and easier to analyze, even when shape logic is incomplete.


### Alternatives considered

1. Create a separate function to support only type inference `infer_types` (preferable) 
2. Add boolean argument `check_shape=True` to the existing `infer_shapes` API (renaming the function is advisable in this case, `infer_shapes_and_types` or similar).


### Describe the feature

Decouple type inference from shape inference.


### Will this influence the current api (Y/N)?

Depends on the alternative selected. 
Can maintain backwards compatiblity.

### Feature Area

shape_inference

### Are you willing to contribute it (Y/N)

None

### Notes

Related issues https://github.com/onnx/onnx/issues/4934
comments: Either `types_only=False` or a new `infer_types()` sounds good to me personally. Contributions welcome!

I am trying to understand the goal here.  Please note that the design already is intended for type-inference to complete even in the presence of incompleteness of shape-inference. Inability to infer shapes will not stop type inference.

However, bugs in the shape inference logic MAY, indeed, prevent the type-inference from completing. 

But inference is based on op-specific inference method, which does not distinguish between type and shape inference. Any approach to do one without the other will require changes within the operator-specific inference method, which could be a lot of work.

Are there specific shape-inference bugs that is interfering with completing type-inference? Any specific example to illustrate what you would like to see?

> I am trying to understand the goal here. Please note that the design already is intended for type-inference to complete even in the presence of incompleteness of shape-inference. Inability to infer shapes will not stop type inference.
> 
> However, bugs in the shape inference logic MAY, indeed, prevent the type-inference from completing.
> 
> But inference is based on op-specific inference method, which does not distinguish between type and shape inference. Any approach to do one without the other will require changes within the operator-specific inference method, which could be a lot of work.
> 
> Are there specific shape-inference bugs that is interfering with completing type-inference? Any specific example to illustrate what you would like to see?

@gramalingam Type inference is typically much simpler than shape inference, and less error-prone. 
Shape inference may fail for dynamic shapes and for data-dependent shape scenarios, but type-inference is always very straight forward.
I would like to be able to modify the input types for a graph and propagate the type information to the graph's outputs reliably.
The main consumer I have in mind is the newly release ModelOpt AutoCast tool ([Readme](https://github.com/NVIDIA/TensorRT-Model-Optimizer/blob/main/docs/source/guides/8_autocast.rst
)). Specifically, I'd like to avoid shape-related failures in this [pass](https://github.com/NVIDIA/TensorRT-Model-Optimizer/blob/main/modelopt/onnx/autocast/precisionconverter.py#L178-L187). The shape inference failures are rare, and typically caused by model issues or wrong input shape, but I'd really like to be able to simplify this to handle only type-inference.
Regardless, I think this is a long-standing anomaly that type inference and shape inference are coupled together.

@galagam : conceptually, yes, having a separate type inference (without shape inference) could help, especially to bypass bugs in shape inference. Inference in ONNX involves both general inference logic, as well as operation-specific inference logic. Separating the type inference logic from shape inference logic in the operator-specific logic can be tedious work. If you have any suggestions on how to do that, would appreciate them.

The simplest approach I can see is to use the fact that the design allows for separate exceptions for type-inference errors and shape-inference errors. So, one possibility is that in the generic inference algorithm, we can catch shape-inference errors, and ignore them, and keep going ... this can be done [here](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/88d94b88fefffa98bc74cbae6fa63798d0d9c9f5/onnx/shape_inference/implementation.cc#L515) I think.

BTW, have you tried setting `strict_mode=False` ? May give a partial workaround. If we don't want to update the operator specific inference method for every op, one possible approach might be to extend this flag setting (see [here](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/7c3b330981e3ba371eaaeb8250c3379636c8fa97/onnx/defs/shape_inference.h#L27)) to have one setting to suppress shape-inference errors, but report type-inference errors.

@gramalingam 

> BTW, have you tried setting strict_mode=False ? May give a partial workaround.

AFAICT setting `strict_mode=False` just allows shape inference to silently fail instead of throwing an exception. This is not effective in this scenario. 

> one possible approach might be to extend this flag setting (see [here](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/7c3b330981e3ba371eaaeb8250c3379636c8fa97/onnx/defs/shape_inference.h#L27)) to have one setting to suppress shape-inference errors, but report type-inference errors.

Extending the flag setting is an interesting idea - I did not consider this. I saw you also suggested this on #7154 . I think it's worth exploring.

> Separating the type inference logic from shape inference logic in the operator-specific logic can be tedious work. If you have any suggestions on how to do that, would appreciate them.

Assuming the above suggestion falls through, and we go for modifying all ops instead, we can probably harness code generating AI agents (such as Cursor or Windsurf) for this task. It's tedious, but very straightforward, which is exactly the kind of tasks these tools excel at. We just need to be clear on the design and backwards compatibility. 
That is: 
- We can only update defs.cc, never old.cc, right? 
- Does it mean we create a new version for every single op with this change?
- What happens if user calls `infer_types` but the node does not have `infer_types` defined (older opset or any other reason)? I'd suggest fall back on infer_shapes, but I'm not sure it's the best approach because it can have unexpected side effects.
In any case, I suggest we keep an pin in that and explore extending `error_mode` first.

Ok, another simplification is possible. There is already a generic type-inference mechanism (that does not rely on the operator-specific inference-method), which works fine for most operators ... it uses the type-annotation attached to inputs and outputs in the operator schema. See the implementation [here](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/ee724f6635ed6c1e81890c9f120ac360000c5370/onnx/defs/schema.cc#L110) and it is called from the general inference [here](https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/ee724f6635ed6c1e81890c9f120ac360000c5370/onnx/shape_inference/implementation.cc#L482)

It is incomplete for special cases for operators where the output type is dependent on an attribute value etc.: like Cast or Constant.

So, it should be sufficient if we implement the type-inference logic only for these handful of operators where the type-annotation is insufficient.

The design already allows for separate exceptions for type-inference errors and shape-inference errors.

Another approach is to use the generic type-inference mechanism that works fine for most operators. The design already allows for separate exceptions for type-inference errors and shape-inference errors.

issueDTO.title: PDF not rendering on iOS version 14/15

Thanks for making this package. I am struggling to get it working on some older devices.

I am trying to get my PDF to load / viewed on iOS14 or iOS15 safari. However the page is just blank. This can be seen going to the demo website on a device using iOS14. https://mui.embedpdf.com/

I am using browserstack to test it and can be seen just visiting the demo site.

issueDTO.title: [Enhancement]: Create IoT Dynamic thing groups
issueDTO.description:
### Description

AWS allows us to create dynamic thing groups.
In AWS CLI, you can create a dynamic thing group specifying `--query-string`:

```
$ aws iot create-dynamic-thing-group --thing-group-name "RoomTooWarm" --query-string "attributes.temperature>60"
```

### Affected Resource(s) and/or Data Source(s)

* aws_iot_thing_group

### Potential Terraform Configuration

```terraform
resource "aws_iot_thing_group" "example" {
  name = "example"
  query = "attributes.temperature>60"
}
```


### References

* <https://docs.aws.amazon.com/iot/latest/developerguide/dynamic-thing-groups.html>

### Would you like to implement a fix?

None

issueDTO.title: feature: More Windows friendly instructions using cmd and powershell for those that cant use WSL
issueDTO.description:
### Feature Description

Most of the commands I've seen when trying to install Kube core or Kubeflex reflect more Mac-focused commands, so I find myself a lot of the time trying to translate so it works with Powershell. if we could add clearer installation instructions so that someone not experienced with Kube or Kubernetes can understand it better and follow the step-by-step in a way that makes more sense/easier to understand.

### Proposed Solution

Adding sections that are more focused on Powershell/cmd instructions with sections like so 

<Windows installation instructions with powershell/cmd> 
installation etc... 

### Want to contribute?

- [ ] I would like to work on this issue.

### Additional Context

_No response_
comments: @rayoazul777 can you open a documentation PR to suggest how you would install KubeStellar on Windows using windows-native instructions?
Hi! Could I give this a shot, if this hasn't been done yet? @clubanderson @rayoazul777
Hello @clubanderson I am working on this already, and I will raise a PR soon.

The problem here is not just powershell vs. bash. Not by far. The much more fundamental issue is that Kubernetes runs Linux containers. If you have a non-WSL way to create Kubernetes clusters on Windows and instantiate Helm charts in those clusters then documenting how to do it with Powershell might make sense.

When you run a (local) model using an inference engine that is compatible with the OpenAI API and you therefore choose to run it in JabRef via the OpenAI AI provider dropdown in the preferences, it will say it is running an OpenAI model, while not necessarily being true. This is the reason for the rename. Ideally, we should split up "OpenAI" and "OpenAI compatible API" into seperate dropdowns, but since that would require more coding work, this issue here exists. The issue should definitely not be closed. Here is an example of me running a [qwen3-14B model](https://huggingface.co/unsloth/Qwen3-14B-GGUF) (which is NOT from OpenAI) via [llama.cpp](https://github.com/ggml-org/llama.cpp) and as you can see the current development version of JabRef claims it is a model from OpenAI (which is not true):

How about we just remove the provider name from processing and only mention the model name? Hmm. But we would be lying, if the (pre and post) processing was done by an ensemble of models, not just one. Then it would be a "service" by the AI provider. Not just a model.

issueDTO.title: Try switching from select2 to tagify in JSON form
issueDTO.description: Select2 isn't compatible with the last version of Drupal. We've been using select2 for a long time but the underlying library is mostly abandoned. There has been no release for years and we need to pull in dev branch just to get it compatible with the current Jquery. Let's try swapping it for https://www.drupal.org/project/tagify and see if anything breaks?
comments:
It appears that neither widget Select2 or Tagify has the functionality and options that we need. We are going to complete more discovery
- Look at auto complete, and what it would take to extend in JSON form

Initial testing shows UI/UX improvements to using the [tagify](https://www.drupal.org/project/tagify) module. There are some limitations to tagify that will require more in depth testing and customization. 

The module provides 2 different elements: 

1. select_tagify:
This element works well with our current approach to building the options in the dropdown. See WidgetRouter.php. No customizations were needed for the list to appear for publisher name, keywords and tags. The limiation are currently that it is not possible to create new keywords/tags directly in the field like you could with select2. The `SelectTagify` class does not have any "#autocreate' capabilities. This would be something we need to look into more and possibly override to get the behavior we are looking for. The other issue I encountered was with the Publishers Name field letting me select multiple options which in theory shouldn't happen based on how I set up the config settings for the element. 

2. entity_autocomplete_tagify
This element does not allow the user to provide the options for the dropdown which is an issue for us. It currently only lets you identify the target entity type 'example:node' down to the entity "data' if needed, one the user starts typing something it will autocomplete and show results in the field. I also ran into an issue where it would not allow me to create new tags within the element like you could with select2, this might just be because of a missing setting although it was not apparent to me what was missing.

The PR [#4467](https://github.com/GetDKAN/dkan/pull/4467) is currently using the select_tagify element. We can use this as a starting point to look into extending the code to allow us to autocreate new tags within the field.

>  The other issue I encountered was with the Publishers Name field letting me select multiple options which in theory shouldn't happen based on how I set up the config settings for the element.

I resolved this by making the list type for the publisher field "select_other". This gives a dropdown where a user can either select a single option from the list or select "other" and create their own.

repository.description: DKAN Open Data Portal
repository.name: dkan

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to try switching from Select2 to Tagify in JSON form and assess the impact on the current functionality and UI/UX.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires validation of the new tag creation functionality and possibly overriding the `SelectTagify` class to achieve the desired behavior.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue with the Publishers Name field letting multiple options be selected was resolved by making the list type for the publisher field 'select_other'.
summary.otherNotes: Select2 isn't compatible with the last version of Drupal. The underlying library is mostly abandoned. Tagify is being considered as a replacement. The module provides two elements: select_tagify and entity_autocomplete_tagify. The select_tagify element has limitations, such as not being able to create new keywords/tags directly in the field. The entity_autocomplete_tagify element does not allow the user to provide options for the dropdown. A PR (#4467) is using the select_tagify element and can be used as a starting point to extend the code to allow autocreation of new tags.

issueDTO.title: Const integer casts
issueDTO.description:
Because we want to support `const` we've started using `as` casts instead of `into()` in the code. This makes the code harder to reason about. But we don't really need to do that. We can simply add a module `const_casts` in `internals` that will have functions like `u8_to_usize`, `u8_to_u32` etc, basically for all implementations of `From`. Similarly we can have feature-gated `u32_to_usize` and `usize_to_u64` for cases where we don't support 16-bit platforms.

Yes, this means that the code doing integer casts in `const` context will become longer but I think it's starting to be worth it since there are many casts and I already got confused by some code.

This issue is easy in principle but involves a bunch of changes.
comments: Yeah, great idea. Let's do it. The casts make me wince every time.

hey, can please confirm if I get your idea correctly before I change all those files? 1. New module 2. Replace all casting with `as` occurrences like this: Edit: not sure yet what to do with those unsafe situations, I am gonna put panic here, do you have a better suggestion?

I appreciate the effort you made to draw all these screenshots but they're compressed and anyway I can't tell what they're supposed to mean. Could you just post a diff?

Also please do not add panics where none exist.
I have edited your comment to use diff highlighting (type ```diff to do this). It is much more readable than screenshots now, thanks!

And to answer your question, yes, concept ACK this approach. Interesting idea to gate the panics on `target_pointer_width`, although really we want the panic only when it's *less than* 64 rather than when it's *not equal to*. Maybe this is impossible to do. In that case I guess we can just special-case the specific values "32" and "64" which will be the overwhelmingly most common ones. Or not bother. This is just an optimization, and a compile-time one at that.

`ToU64` is about dealing with `usize` not having a fixed size. It is not about casts that are well-defined and guaranteed to be correct.

`ToU64` is also part of the public API. const casts should not be.

summary.otherNotes: The issue involves a bunch of changes, including creating a new module, replacing all casting with 'as' occurrences, and dealing with unsafe situations. The author suggests using 'git diff' for readability, but the comment suggests that it's not the best option. The issue also involves optimization and feature-gating for certain platforms.

issueDTO.title: tracker: improve the kubelet test coverage
issueDTO.description:
There is a strong and growing consensus in sig-node about the need of increasing the test coverage in the kubelet, improving the current testsuite about coverage and reliability. See for example the [April 26 sig-node meeting notes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ne57gvidMEWXR70OxxnRkYquAoMpt56o75oZtg-OeBg/edit#heading=h.d9zp2j5jvkke) and the [April 27 sig-node CI subgroup meeting notes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fb-ugvgdSVIkkuJ388_nhp2pBTy_4HEVg5848Xy7n5U/edit#heading=h.2v8vzknys4nk).

This work has already begun and there are already some PR posted (see: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/108024#pullrequestreview-954083698). This is a great start. There are more areas in the kubelet, especially in the container manager and resource manager area, that can use better unit test coverage.

Besides the obvious benefits of documenting and preserving the current behaviour, adding tests is meant to lower the barrier for future work and contributions.

Examples of some areas which can benefit of more tests:

- k/k/pkg/kubelet/cm/internal_container_lifecycle.go
- k/k/pkg/kubelet/cm/internal_container_lifecycle_linux.go
- k/k/pkg/kubelet/cm/pod_container_manager_linux.go
- k/k/pkg/kubelet/cm/qos_container_manager_linux.go
- everything coverage-driven (check [test code coverage](https://go.dev/blog/cover) and build from there)
- error paths in general
-  e2e tests in general

### Review Mojo's priorities

- [X] I have read the [roadmap and priorities](https://docs.modular.com/mojo/roadmap.html#overall-priorities) and I believe this request falls within the priorities.

### What is your request?

Create a trait for the `__divmod__` method. In its simplest form, it would look like this in a struct:

`fn __divmod__(self: Self, other: Self) -> Tuple[Self, Self]`


### What is your motivation for this change?

Each dunder method has its own trait. We should do it for `__divmod__` too. 

See https://github.com/modularml/mojo/pull/2097#discussion_r1591144433


### Any other details?

While trying to implement it, I encountered a blocking error. See the issue https://github.com/modularml/mojo/issues/2597 . It might be a compiler bug, or I might misuse traits.

issueDTO.title: Add rearrange operator to PyTorch natively
issueDTO.description:
### 🚀 The feature, motivation and pitch

Today, the rearrange from einops is very essential to write cleaner code within most transformers architecture and beyond. 

```python
     q = rearrange(query, 'b s (h d) -> (b s) h d', h=h)
     kv = rearrange(kv, 'b s t (h d) -> (b s) t h d', h=h)
```

However, einops comes with some caviats and need to be installed additionally to PyTorch.

I strongly believe PyTorch should provide its own optimised rearrange functional operator.

Best,
T.C

### Alternatives

Stick with einops, but I would prefer not.

### Additional context

_No response_

cc @ezyang @gchanan @zou3519 @kadeng @msaroufim @albanD @Chillee @samdow @kshitij12345 @janeyx99
comments: cc @janeyx99
cc @zdevito
Pytorch provides first-class dims with similar functionality https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/functorch/dim/README.md#reshaping-tensors-einops
@ngimel well......... it is a bit different haha.
Also, some users on twitter asking for this: https://twitter.com/ddetone/status/1619055524196253698, https://twitter.com/francoisfleuret/status/1583704549704888320
It allows splitting and flattening dims, what's different?
Can't someone just parse the rearrange string and then convert it into a sequence of first class dims. Seems like a fun project.
Hi, could I be assigned this?

> However, einops comes with some caviats

@tchaton could you explain what you view as the caveats?
Sure. This should be prototyped as a standalone Python file that implements rearrange in terms of first class dims. Not sure what the best way to do the parser is

Should `rearrange` eventually live in `torch/functional.py` alongside e.g. einsum?

Should we also assume that `functorch`, and in particular, `functorch.dim` is available as a dependency for the `torch` dir?

> Should we also assume that functorch, and in particular, functorch.dim is available as a dependency for the torch dir?

Turns out this is not possible due to circular dependency (functorch depends on torch, so torch cannot depend on functorch). Looks like it will have to live in `functorch`.

As for the parser, I went with a very thin wrapper for simplicity.
Once we have a working implementation we can figure out where to put it; we may be able to use a lazy import to deal with the circular dependency
this issue is still open or  was  this closed  with the pull request linked above
It's in progress via linked pr

@ezyang E.g. in Mamba by @albertfgu https://github.com/state-spaces/mamba/blob/main/mamba_ssm/ops/selective_scan_interface.py#L7 are used `from einops import rearrange, repeat`. Are these now natively available in PyTorch? (as `from functorch.einops import rearrange` seems to work, but `from torch.func.einops import rearrange` does not)

@ezyang I guess should there be a roll-up issue about remaining popular einops functions used by lucid-rains and state_spaces?
cc @zou3519 on torch.funcs.einops working or not

What is `torch.func.einops`? Looking at [`torch.func` now](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/8a209344c9900678dcf55d75783338f161341ccb/torch/func/__init__.py) and its history, I don't see that `einops` ever existed inside it.
functorch/einops exists, I feel like we just never exposed it in torch.func namespace
An addition to `torch.func` would be appreciated! ???

@zou3519 @ezyang found this the other day while using `einops.rearrange` so submitted a [PR](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/146825) moving `functorch.einops.rearrange` to `torch.func.rearrange`. I feel it would be nice to keep the namespace like `torch.func.einops.rearrange` but not sure if it is worth it to introduce a namespace for one function...

Given appearance of `rearrange` in AGI-discovered architectures source codes, would be great to have it finally supported natively by PyTorch without needing a dependency on `einops` :)

https://gair-nlp.github.io/ASI-Arch/

issueDTO.title: Attach??`Diagnostic`??to "duplicate table name" error
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem or challenge?

For a query like:

```sql
SELECT * FROM users a, users a
```

The only message that the end user of an application built atop of DataFusion sees is:

```
Schema error: Schema contains duplicate qualified field name a.id
```

Similarly, for:

```sql
WITH cte AS (SELECT 1 AS col), cte AS (SELECT 2 AS col) SELECT 1
```

We get:

```
Error during planning: WITH query name "cte" specified more than once
```

We want to provide a richer message that _references and highlights locations in the original SQL query_, and contextualises and helps the user understand the error. In the end, it would be possible to display errors in a fashion akin to what was enabled by #13664 for some errors:

![](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/32efeb4f-aad9-41c9-a1e3-600a00d525c3)

See #14429 for more information.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Attach a well crafted `Diagnostic` to the `DataFusionError`, building on top of the foundations laid in #13664. See #14429 for more information.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

issueDTO.title: Request feature to load balance across multiple Kafka topics
issueDTO.description:
We have a very large deployment and we hit limits on what a single Kafka topic can support. Limitation is due to the number of nodes partitions, number of disks on nodes number threads etc... We find keeping our topics to a manageable size we have less issues. Can you add a feature to Kafka output to load balance across multiple topics? 

I know we can set the policy to point to different paths with different backends in the endpoints but that defeats the autoscaling load balancing that this service can support. 

Maybe a number_of_topics where _# could be appended to topic names like  topic_1, topic_2 etc???
base_topic_name = "topic_base_name"
number_of_topics = 3
Results in incoming messages being published to topics topic_base_name_1, topic_base_name_2, topic_base_name_3

Or topics be made a list...
topics = "topic_base_name_1, topic_base_name_2, topic_base_name_3"
comments:
Hi!

I'm quite surprised that you reached the limits of Kafka by collecting events with OpenWEC. Out of curiosity, could you share an estimate of how many machines you are collecting events from and what your traffic is like (e.g. number of events, byte rate)?

I don't understand how increasing the number of topics would improve performance (except if you have only one partition per topic). Could you share a documentation or an article stating about that? 

I would rather suggest to:
- increase the number of partitions in your topic
- increase the number of nodes in the Kafka cluster (at least one partition per node)
- improve the storage technology used to store Kafka partitions (SSD)
- tweak producer(s) configuration (batch size for example)
- tweak consumer(s) configuration
- tweak topic configuration (e.g. partition size, partition retention time)

Hi! I am from Brian's team. We have 100k+ workstations and ~5500 servers that we going to collect from. 

If there is a substantially huge volume on one single topic, it fills up the disk unevenly on a Kafka cluster.  This makes the team go into maintenance mode, rebalancing partitions which is tedious, sometimes error prone and time consuming all while hoping we don't miss realtime logs. So we have retention time and retention bytes applied to the partition. This keeps the busy work from us. But this means we need to monitor the volume and split the topic into more as they reach a certain level otherwise retention time criteria is not met.
Our consumers scaling logic is shared across all log sources including wef. They all(300+) scale for up to 24 partitions so we don't have to handle scaling on case by case basis.

So we keep it fixed to 24 and make new topics if we reach more volume(message/sec) or more size(bytes/sec) than a number.

Long story short, one could use 100s of partitions in Kafka on single topic if we are building a new system just to process windows events but after having tuned all other bits and pieces of the system, an ability to load balance across topics would make our life easier.

Forwarders like winlogbeats, logstash, etc. provide some sort of scripting and variable name for topic etc.. that we use to split volume to multiple topics. Does openwec has similar capability? Hoping we could work around.

Thanks for the explanations! I'm very interested in knowing how you deployed OpenWEC and how it behaves with that type of charge. 

> Does openwec has similar capability?

We don't have that feature yet.

As you mentioned, if the Kafka driver configuration contains multiple topics, the expected behavior is for the received events to be distributed fairly among the configured topics. This behavior does not seem to be implemented in the Kafka producer library itself, so we need to implement it ourselves. However, the Kafka producer library can send each message (e.g., a Windows event) to a different topic.

Currently, the Kafka driver is stateless. This means that we cannot use a "global" round-robin index to fairly rotate between topics without making significant changes to the Kafka driver logic and possibly impacting performance. The Kafka driver, however, receives a batch of events to send in a single "write" call (https://github.com/cea-sec/openwec/blob/main/server/src/drivers/kafka.rs#L84). Therefore, I think we can use a "local" round-robin index to achieve relative fairness. The idea is to start at a random position in the topics array and iterate through the array for each event.

I prefer your second proposal of adding a "topics" parameter to the Kafka driver configuration that contains a pre-made topics list. This approach seems much easier to understand and less likely to be used incorrectly. Additionally, if both "topics" and "topic" are present, an error should be raised.

Does this approach feel reasonable to you? It does not seem difficult to implement. Would you be interested in implementing it?
Yes that would be perfect
"Would you be interested in implementing it?" If you mean, would we be able to deploy and test in our environment; then yes, we can validate feature runs in a large-scale environment.

summary.attemptedFixes: The author suggests increasing the number of partitions in the topic, increasing the number of nodes in the Kafka cluster, improving storage technology, tweaking producer and consumer configurations, and tweaking topic configuration. The author suggests adding a feature to Kafka output to load balance across multiple topics. The current Kafka producer library does not support this feature and the author proposes implementing it themselves.

issueDTO.title: [REFACTOR] <Views Tests>: Refactor Views Tests Setup to Use setUpTestData for Improved Performance
issueDTO.description:
**Why should this code be refactored?**

The current use of the `setUp` method runs before every test, causing unnecessary repeated database setup and slowing down test execution. Replacing it with a class-level `setUpTestData` can significantly improve test performance by setting up test data once per test class.

**Scope of Refactoring**

Refactor test classes that currently use `setUp` to initialize test data and replace it with:
```
@classmethod
def setUpTestData(cls)
```

**Expected Benefits**

Faster test suite execution due to reduced redundant database operations, improved maintainability by centralizing test data setup

**Potential Risks or Challenges**

Some tests might unintentionally modify shared test data, causing inter-test dependencies. Careful review and test isolation checks will be necessary after refactoring.

**Additional Notes**

Refer to Django???s documentation on [setUpTestData](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/5.2/topics/testing/tools/#django.test.TestCase.setUpTestData) for best practices. Consider running the full test suite to ensure no side effects occur.
comments:
Hi @Lorygold! 

I'd like to work on this refactoring issue. After going through the repo I found **21 test files** across the project that use `setUp()` methods, with the views tests being the primary performance bottleneck:

**Main Target Files:**
- test_views.py - **545 lines** with heavy database setup (5 Users, 4 Logins, 6 Alerts) running before **every test method** (12+ methods)
- test_view_elasticsearch_ingestion.py - Already partially optimized but can be improved ig

**Additional Files Using setUp():**
- 6 alerting test files
- 4 ingestion test files  
- 3 detection test files
- Various API and management command tests

Some files already use `setUpTestData` correctly:
- test_http_request_alerting.py
- test_webhook_alerting.py 
- test_alert_filter.py


Could you please assign this issue to me? I'd be happy to help! 
Thanks

issueDTO.title: Move current docs to myst
issueDTO.description:
Move any sections of the docs to myst using rst-myst command line tool. 

- Make the PR from stable
- Install  [rst2myst](https://rst-to-myst.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) with uvx since its requirements are not up to date so it will downgrade your sphinx if you install it in the project environment.
- Use to convert 1 file (for example contrib.rst)
- Fix typos.
-  Make PR for that 1 file. If you are planing on helping out will multiple sections, then submit 1 or 2, and I will review them and then you can do more. Because the rst2myst does make mistakes, the reviewer(probably me) needs to click on every link and check carefully line by line.  

Just add a comment to what section you are working on. 

An unfortunate downside is that the git blame will be reset for the docs files. 

The index.rst file needs to be the last file converted since I cannot figure out to have rst files and a md file as the index.  See [myst docs](https://myst-parser.readthedocs.io/en/latest/syntax/roles-and-directives.html#roles-directivesl) for how to use myst with sphinx roles.  We have a custom roles that will need eval-rst. Check other docs already created for examples and [click-extra docs](https://kdeldycke.github.io/click-extra/sphinx.html#click-directives) for how the roles work.

Hey @Rowlando13, FYI, I just added [support of MyST syntax](https://kdeldycke.github.io/click-extra/sphinx.html#click-directives) for the `click:example` and `click:run` Sphinx directives.

With that you can use natural MyST syntax like:
````markdown
```{click:run}
invoke(hello_world, args=["--name", "Joe"])
```
````

Instead of the ugly:
````markdown
```{eval-rst}
.. click:run::
    invoke(hello_world, args=["--name", "Joe"])
```
````

It will be available in the upcoming [Click Extra 5.1.0](https://github.com/kdeldycke/click-extra/blob/main/changelog.md) (which is pending Click 8.2.2 release).

issueDTO.title: Remove the organization scopes getting issued for the token issued for the root organizations.
issueDTO.description:
### Current Limitation

When organization APIs are subscribed to applications, the organization API related scopes are issued if requested. There is no use of such scopes as those scopes are not relevant when calling the tenant APIs.

### Suggested Improvement

Hence we can filter out the org scopes.

For an example, console app, we get large scope set with org scopes. We can reduce the response and processing when we reduce the scope count (This might nearly reduced by half)

issueDTO.title: add `ValidatingAdmissionPolicy` resource from k8s `v1.28.0`
issueDTO.description:
### Description

<!--- Please leave a helpful description of the feature request here. --->

https://kubernetes.io/blog/2023/08/15/kubernetes-v1-28-release/#validatingadmissionpolicies-graduate-to-beta
https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/validating-admission-policy/

with `ValidatingAdmissionPolicy` being moved to the beta state in `v1.28.0` we should consider whether this resource should be a high priority or wait until it has reached the stable state.

### YAML configuration
<!--- Information about code formatting: https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/#quoting-code --->

```yaml
apiVersion: admissionregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1
kind: ValidatingAdmissionPolicy
metadata:
  name: "demo-policy.example.com"
spec:
  failurePolicy: Fail
  matchConstraints:
    resourceRules:
    - apiGroups:   ["apps"]
      apiVersions: ["v1"]
      operations:  ["CREATE", "UPDATE"]
      resources:   ["deployments"]
  validations:
    - expression: "object.spec.replicas <= 5"
```

### References

<!---
Information about referencing Github Issues: https://help.github.com/articles/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax/#referencing-issues-and-pull-requests

Are there any other GitHub issues (open or closed) or pull requests that should be linked here? Vendor blog posts or documentation?
--->

<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

### Community Note

* Please vote on this issue by adding a 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->
comments:
Referencing https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.29/#validatingadmissionpolicy-v1beta1-admissionregistration-k8s-io

Since this would be the schema for the `ValidatingAdmissionPolicy` resource

The provider typically does not implement resources where there is a feature gate that defaults to false. This is because cloud provisioned clusters generally do not have the option to set feature gates to true. Unfortunately the feature gate `ValidatingAdmissionPolicy` defaults to `false` as of v1.28, [see docs](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/command-line-tools-reference/feature-gates/#feature-gates-for-alpha-or-beta-features).
@appilon according to the doc that you've shared`ValidatingAdmissionPolicy` defaults to `true` nowadays (starting from k8s 1.30 is in GA)

> @appilon according to the doc that you've shared`ValidatingAdmissionPolicy` defaults to `true` nowadays (starting from k8s 1.30 is in GA)

Thanks for the update! Marking this as `good first issue` / `help wanted` @skraga you're welcome to open a PR if interested. Refer to [`CONTRIBUTING.md`](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-kubernetes/blob/main/_about/CONTRIBUTING.md)
interested in this one @aayushsss1? @JaylonmcShan03 can review once the PR is open.
Hey @BBBmau thanks, I can take this up!
marked as blocked and moved to `v3.0.0` since this requires a k8s version bump which will be addressed in the next major version release of the provider.

issueDTO.title: [ENHANCEMENT][TS]: In-memory dataset usage in runExperiment parameters
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

It would be nice to run an experiment against an in-memory dataset, without persisting the dataset afterwards.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Pass in a "dataset" via parameters, with examples, that is not persisted afterwards, instead of a dataset id.

Something like

```ts
const experiment = await runExperiment({
  dataset: {
    name: "qa-capital-france",
    description: "Single-prompt dataset for capital city QA",
    examples: [
      {
        input: { prompt: "What is the capital of France?" },
        output: { text: "Paris" },
        metadata: {},
      },
    ],
  },
  task,
  evaluators
});
```

### Describe any alternative solutions you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

https://arize-ai.slack.com/archives/C04R3GXC8HK/p1751374792815499

### Social Media Handle

_No response_

Various [unit tests](https://github.com/hoppscotch/hoppscotch/tree/main/packages/hoppscotch-cli/src/__tests__/functions) exist for the CLI, but they are disabled at the moment because they were found flaky. issueDTO.title: Pointwise heuristics incorrect memory access estimation
issueDTO.description:
> Hmm... I don't think the original code of this part makes sense. The unit of `cur_transfer_size` and `right_transfer_size` were in the unit of `byte ^ N`, where `N` is the number of dimensions on the left/right of the break point. My PR will change it to `bit ^ N`, so in this sense, my PR is NOT a no-op. But I believe we should not block my PR because of this. Instead, we should fix it in a later PR.

_Originally posted by @zasdfgbnm in https://github.com/NVIDIA/Fuser/pull/4748#discussion_r2199798284_
